texts.es: Miguel Antonio H. A. de 52 años, vive junto a su esposa y un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, quien depende por completo de Miguel y junto a quienes reside en Apopa. Él es un señor muy responsable, quien trabaja como albañil, oficio que realiza desde hace 30 años atrás, lo que lo hace todo un experto en reparar diferentes objetos. Miguel desea mucho salir adelante y de esta manera brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar todas las herramientas necesarias como: tornillos, soldadores, llaves y otros más los cuales le permitan hacer más eficiente su trabajo. De esta manera Miguel espera salir adelante y contar con una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Miguel Antonio H. A., age 52, lives with his wife and his little four year old son.  His son is completely dependent upon Miguel.  They live together in Apopa.  

He is a very responsible man who works as a builder.  He has been doing this work for 30 years.  That makes him a complete expert at repairing different things.  Miguel very much wishes to get ahead and offer his family everything they need.

That is why he is requesting a loan from Integral.  With the loan he will be able to buy the tools he needs like screws, soldering-irons, wrenches, and more.  They will allow him to do his work more efficiently.  That way Miguel hopes to get ahead and have a better life.

loans.use: to buy tools to do his work

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Ou

texts.en: Ou P. resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. P. sells cow ties, earning an income of $3 per day. Her husband raises chickens and ducks, earning an income of $1.60 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $80 on food and $100 on the other necessary expenses. P. is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase more cow ties and clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be P.'s second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase ties and clothes to sell

loans.name: Memsu Group

texts.en:
Isatu J. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in Makeni city, about 38 years ago. She is married to a teacher and the couple has one child who is attending secondary school. Isatu sells gara lappers (locally dyed cloth) and has been in this business for five years now.

With the help of this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan, 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean leones (SLL),  to buy gara lapper making materials--ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton cloth, etc.--in order to produce a larger quantity of cloth for sale.

loans.use: to buy materials for making dyed cloth

loans.name: Mujurizi

texts.en: Mujurizi E. is an individual client from Bushenyi. He is 26 years old and single. He is into the business of selling produce like beans, millet, cotton, groundnuts and maize. hH operates from his home in Nyamirima, selling mostly to other bigger traders from neighboring districts and town dwellers, and he is able to make 420,000/= as monthly profits. He has been in the business for over 4 years, after working for someone else, until he started his own business. His dream is to be able to grow his business and get married. He also grows cotton and coffee on plantations. He is a very hard-working young man, and he needs a loan to be able to buy more produce and cereals for resale.

loans.use: to buy more produce and cereals for resale

loans.name: C4707 Intwari Group

texts.en:
Elisa is 22 years old and is single. He is the representative of a group called "Intwari" in the local language. Elisa is the first person on the left, with his hand raised. 

Elisa has a beauty salon in Kigali which attracts many working-class clients. He has been in this business for one year.  His beauty salon is well organized; he is open from 8am until 7pm every day and employs three people to help him. One of the challenges in his business is not having enough equipment in the hair salon, especially for women clients.

Elisa and his group have requested a loan from a Kiva lender in order to purchase new equipment for Elisa's beauty salon. With this profit, Elisa will reinvest in his business and save for his family.

loans.use: To buy new equipment for his salon

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
Hortensia nació en la comunidad de Arin departamento (Cusco, Perú), tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y sus tres hijos, quien son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. 

Los verdes campos de la comunidad de Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado de los Incas donde actualmente vive, han sido en la vida de Hortensia un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran hortalizas como por ejemplo papa, maíz y otras vegetales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido de mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en las ciudades de Urubamba y Cusco. Hortensia solicita el préstamo para realizar unos de sus planes, que es incrementar la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Ella tiene la obligación de pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles, comprará gallinas blancas y semillas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Hortensia was born in Arin community, in Cusco department, Peru.  She is 41 years old and is a very cheerful and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner and three children who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

The green fields of Arin community (which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas and is where Hortensia currently lives), have been a very pleasant place for Hortensia to work over the years.  Her parents taught her to farm when she was very young and now she owns her own land on which she works together with her partner.  With a lot of care, they sow vegetables such as potatoes and corn.  What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land since then she feels that all her hard work is paying off.  Hortensia has been in this business for years and she considers the most difficult part of her business to be transporting her crops to the warehouses which are located in the cities of Urubamba and Cusco.

Hortensia is requesting this loan to carry out one of her plans which is to expand her business raising animals such as hens and guinea pigs.  She must make her repayments on time and she is prepared to do so as she would like to access future loans.  She is grateful to the institution for granting her this loan.  She will use the 1,500 Peruvian soles to buy white hens and seeds to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy white hens and seeds so that she can increase her production

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 48 años de edad,  ella tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad, actualmente no cuenta con carga familiar directa, blanca con casa propia la cual está ubicada en una zona rural del distrito de Chiclayo.

Blanca Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio la cual es atendida por ella misma, hace 3 años. Allí ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, haci como también bebidas, el negación tiene buena cogida y en este tiempo a conseguido tener clientela fija.

Blanca está  solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles  para que pueda acondicionar un espacio de sus casa solo para la venta de cerveza, cuales tienen muy buen nivel de ventas los fines de semanas.

Blanca es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 48, has two grown children.  She does not currently have any dependent relatives.  Blanca has her own house, which is located in a rural area in the Chiclayo district.  

Blanca has a small general store set up in her house.  She has been taking care of it herself for three years.  She sells to her neighbors and customers in the area.  She sells diverse daily consumption products, basic needs products, and groceries.  She also sells drinks.  The business is well received, and she has managed to get regular customers.

Blanca is requesting a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She will use the loan to set up a space in her house solely for the sale of beer.  There is a good level of beer sales on the week-ends.

Blanca is a very hard-working woman and is of good moral character.  The people who know her hold her in high esteem and are fond of her.

loans.use: to fix up a space in her business in order to sell beer.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, 48 years old, does braiding with her husband. Their income is $8 per day. They have three children, and they are 22, 21, and 19 years old. All of them are working in the factory and get $5 for each day.  

Every month, she has to spend $25 on food, $6 on electricity, $15 on rent and $50 on transportation and other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorbike for her children to get to work. 

In the future, she wants to have a good house, because now her house is not in good condition and needs a lot of repair.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children get to work.

loans.name: Kassofor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03juin 2010. Ledit groupe est  constitué de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Fatou Bintou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge trois autres enfants confié par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de poisson et de sucre. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et d'accroitre  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 3, 2010. It comprises eleven women who live in the same area. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. Ms. Fatou Bintou (at the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She also supports three other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

Fatou is active in selling fish and sugar. She has good experience in this domain of work, which she has been doing for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to increase her business. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy fish and sugar

loans.name: Benyamin

texts.en:
Benyamin is a 42 year-old man, married to Diana, a 37 year-old lady. Their marriage has been blessed with four adorable children, namely Yeti, a sixteen year-old girl who is in the second year of senior high school; Fernando, a 14 year-old boy in the second year of junior high school; Samaria, an 11 year-old girl in the fourth grade of elementary school; and Frits, a 7 year-old boy in the second grade of elementary school.

Benyamin has been running a room rental business for seven years in order to fulfill the basic needs of his family.  His wife is working as a seamstress to assist him in generating money for their living. By setting up his unused rooms, he has attracted the students who come from countryside and want to continue study in the city, but don't have any relatives or place to stay.  They can rent a small room with access to clean water and electricity and pay IDR 75,000 on a monthly basis. 

Benyamin is dreaming of renovating his rental house but needs money to do so. He met TLM’s loan officer who promoted TLM’s lending program to the community in his village. Benyamin got interested in joining the program. He is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000. Benyamin is hoping that he gets the loan to purchase zinc, cement and other materials to renovate his rental house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate the rooms to be leased

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia, a 50-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a retail shop selling fish such as sardines and mackerel for the last five years. A new member of HSPFI, Alicia has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell, and hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 51 years old and is married with three children aged between 15 and 21 years old. She sells animals such as chickens and goats. Her business is well-organized. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 7 pm every day. She has five years experience in this business and she employs one person to help her. Alice has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more animals to raise and sell. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and goats for sale

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en: Bibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past year, Bibi has operated a business making tea for sale, selling at the school site to school teachers and school children. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase two goats, tea leaves, and sugar for making tea for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase two goats, tea leaves, and sugar for making tea for sale.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is from the village of Vardisubani in the Kakheti region of East Georgia. He is 56 years old and lives with his wife, Nani. 

Nani works as a teacher in the local school. Albert is a joiner. He has his own workshop, where he produces home furniture, mainly beds. He sells his products in Tbilisi, in a trade center. His total average monthly income is 1,100 GEL. 

Albert requested credit for purchasing wood as a raw material for his workshop. He will make beds and sell them in Tbilisi in the fall. In the fall, the demand for home furniture, as well as prices, will increase in comparison to the summer months. By that time, Albert will have products ready to supply the market. 

In the future, Albert plans to save some of his income for house renovation, in order to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his workshop.

loans.name: Sadullo

texts.ru: Садулло целеустремленный и честный человек. Он занимается перевозкой пассажиров на местном города. Он относятся со своими клиентами добро и мягко. Он начинал данный бизнес 7 лет назад с арендованным автомобилям. Постепенно зарабатывая денег, он купил себе автомобиль марки «Газель-2705». Садулло хотел бы получить займ для установки газового оборудования и покупка автошин в зимний период.
texts.en: Sadullo is a purposeful and honest man. He transports passengers around local towns. He treats his customers kindly and gently. He started his business seven years ago with a rented vehicle. Step by step by earning money he bought himself a car of brand Gazel-2705. Sadullo wants to get a loan to install gas equipment and to buy tires for the winter season.

loans.use: to buy tires for the car and to install gas equipment

loans.name: Mehrob

texts.ru: Мехроб занимается купля продажей продукты питания. Он имеет магазин, в котором продает широкий ассортимент продукты питания. Он начинал данный бизнес с 5000 Сомони а постепенно увеличивал свой оборотный капитал. Его торговая точка находится в жилом районе города и вблизи от его магазина находиться профилакторий, что благоприятно влияет на его торговлю. От данного бизнеса он получает стабильный доход, и он очень хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить ассортимента продукта. С этой целью Мехроб запрашивает займ в размере 12000 Сомони.
texts.en: Mehrob is involved in buying and selling food products.  He has a store, where he sells a wide assortment of food products.  He started his business with 5000 Somoni and gradually increased his revolving capital.  Mehrob's store is located in a residential neighborhood of the town, and there is a treatment facility near his store, which positively affects his sales.  He earns a stable income from this business, wants to expand his business and expand an assortment of products.  This is why Mehrob is requesting a loan in the sum of 12000 Somoni.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of food products

loans.name: Marlina

texts.en: Marlina is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children and has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. Marlina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Fifa Christon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement FIFA CHRISTON est formé de vingt cinq personnes qui habitent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Amelin Alphonsine est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Amelin Alphonsine est âgée de 55 ans, et est mariée à un douanier du nom de Valère. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Amelin Alphonsine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une vingtaine d’année, Amelin Alphonsine  vend des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution ; ce qui permet d’assurer ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Amelin Alphonsine achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo. C’est la deuxième fois que Amelin Alphonsine et les autres membres du groupement FIFA CHRISTON sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group FIFA CHRISTON is made up of 25 persons who all live in the same district in Bénin. The representative of this group, Amelin Alphonsine, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Amelin Alphonsine is 55 and married to a customs agent named Valère. The couple have four children, all living under their roof. 

Amelin Alphonsine did not go to school. For about 20 years, she has been selling kitchen utensils through the distribution system, allowing her to help her husband support their family. Amelin Alphonsine buys her products in Bénin and in Togo. It's the second time that she and the other members of the group called FIFA CHRISTON are requesting a loan from ALIDé. This loan will permit them to expand their businesses so as to be better able to respond to the needs of their clientele. The first loan was correctly reimbursed.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 44-year-old man. He is married and has one son and three daughters. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Sami wants to purchase new home furniture to improve his family's living conditions. He wants to buy bedroom furniture for the children, dining room furniture, living room seats, etc., but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. 

When Sami gets the loan, he will be able to change his family's life positively by purchasing new home furniture. Sami is photographed in a FATEN branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Clavelitos De Villa Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CLAVELITOS DE VILLA INGENIO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Julieta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, costura de edredones, venta de comida, venta de pescado.

La señora Julieta,  indica que es la primera ves trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de edredones que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de sus amigas.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá del de la 16 de Julio, por mayor, y posteriormente lo venderá en los puestos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "CLAVELITOS DE VILLA INGENIO" will begin its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the regional hub Los Andes. It is made up of eight members and is guided by a board of directors headed by Julieta. The businesses that the members of the communal bank are involved in vary, and among them we have: knitting sweaters, a neighborhood store, sewing quilts, selling food, and selling fish.

Julieta says this is her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the organization at the invitation of her friends. She currently has a business sewing quilts, which she has been working at for years, having learned it from friends.

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital (to buy fabric) which she will acquire at the July 16th marketplace, wholesale, and afterwards she will sell it in stalls. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the loan education.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 33 years old, married and has one child. She lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Mae has been selling clothing for the past five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000. She is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Mae has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Mae hopes to save for the education of her son.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothes for her business.

loans.name: Serapia Rosalia

texts.es: Serapia,es viuda tiene 55 años de edad tiene 6 hijos pero con ella solo tiene a la hija de 16 años de edad ya que los demas son casados ella se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y venta de ponchos, ropa, zapatos ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años cuando sus hijos iban a la escuela ya que sus esposo se dedicaba a trabajar en el campo y lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba para sostener a su familia,con el paso del tiempo ella ha incrementado sus ventas ella esta solicitando este credito para comprar mas mercaderia para surtir mas su tienda,espera que kiva le pueda ayudar.
texts.en: Serapia is a 55 year old widow, has six children but only her 16 year old daughter lives with her as her other children are married, she sells groceries and ponchos, clothes and shoes, she started this business 25 years ago when her children were going to school because her husband worked farming and what he earned was not sufficient to support the family, as time went by she increased sales and requests a loa to buy more merchandise and stock her store, she hopes that Kiva can help.

loans.use: to buy groceries, ponchos, jackets and shoes.

loans.name: Torees Group

texts.en:
Catherine, who is in her late 30's, is married with one child who is still a baby. Catherine has been running a tailoring business for 15 years now. She works from 8.00 a.m. to 5.30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy another sewing machine and take care of her family and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants a loan to buy materials and make more women's clothes. Her dream is to one day be able to open a tailoring school.  

She will share this loan with her loan group "Torees group" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy materials and make more women's clothes

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo tiene 38 años de edad, está casado hace 16 años con la señora Victorina de 37 años, tienen dos hijos, uno de 15 y 10 años respectivamente, el mayor está cursando el primer años de la media y la menor está en el 4to. Grado.
El sr. Pablo se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 5 años, trabajo mucho tiempo como empleado, luego salió de su trabajo y de su liquidación monto para su propio negocio, su señora tambien trabaja y juntos se ayudan a llevar adelante los gastos de la familia. Pablo tiene como prioridad mantener una familia estable y que sus hijos tenga la posibilidad de terminar una carrera universitaria.                                                                         Solicita este préstamo para la compra de madera, terciadas, clavos que lo utilizará en su carpineria ya que llega fin de año y cuenta con varios pedidos y asi cumplir con su clientela.-
texts.en:
Pablo is 38 years old. He has ben married for 16 years to Victorina, who is 37. They have two children, aged 15 and 10. The oldest is in the first years of high school and the youngest is in 4th grade.
  
Pablo has been a carpenter for 5 years. He worked as an employee for many years, and later left his job. With his severance he started his own business. His wife also works and together they help each other to pay for the family expenses. Pablo's priority is keeping his family stable and giving his children the chance to finish college. 
                                                                         
He is asking for this loan to buy wood, plywood and nails which he will use in his carpentry. The end of the year is approaching and he has several orders and this way he can satisfy his customers.

loans.use: Comprar madera, plywood, nails, etc.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 38 years old, married, and has three children. She has been selling clothes for the last 17 years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). 

She is requesting her first loan with KADET Ltd of 50,000 KES. She plans to use the funds to purchase more clothes for sale. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children and grow her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children to college level and expand her business to be a big clothes store.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Remia

texts.en: Remia is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. Remia has a shop that buys and sells a variety or different kinds of dried fish. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Remia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Harold

texts.en: Harold is a 40 year old married man with five children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and has been in service for a period of 15 years. He would like to educate is children,upgrade in his studies, and buy land. Harold wants a loan to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land .

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Madame Diodio est une femme marié âgé de 38 ans et mère de 6 enfants .Diodio est membre du banc villageois depuis le 26/12/2011. Elle est lié avec ses camarades par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques.
Elle s'active dans le petit commerce depuis longtemps. Diodio est debout à droite de la photo la main levée habillée en grand boubou vert olive.
Son nouveau crédit de 75000 francs lui permettra de se procurer des paniers de poissons au niveau de la plage et de les revendre au détails dans son quartier.
les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charges certaines charges familiales telles que la scolarité et l 'alimentation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Madame Diodio is a 38 year old married woman and mother of six children. Diodio has been a member of the village lending group since 12/26/2011. She is linked with the other members by good social and financial relations.
She has been active in small business for a long time. Diodio is standing up at the right of the photo with her hand raised in the long olive green tunic.
Her new loan of 75,000 francs will allow her to buy baskets of fish at the beach and resell them individually in her area.
The profits generated by this business will allow her to take care of various expenses of her family, such as the education and nourishment of her children.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a twenty-two-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He cooperates with his father and sibling to meet the family's living needs. He is an aluminum worker who has worked in this area since 2009. He is a freelancer who responds to both individual and corporate demands. He is very brave and always finishes his work with satisfying results. At present, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase items and aluminum tools needed to properly proceed with his business operations. In the future, Hasan looks forward to becoming the owner of an appropriate factory.

loans.use: purchase items and aluminum tools

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en: Cyrus is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a barber shop and also sells clothes outside the barber shop. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a prime area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to upgrade the barber shop and add more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved standards of living.

loans.use: to upgrade the barber shop and add more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is an active member Kabuta Ladies in Action a group she joined in 2001. She is married with 2 children who go to primary and secondary School.

She started her business with her husband in 2001. The business has grown over the years to be the best in Muranga Town and this has led to the opening of another outlet on another street. On average the butchery sells 100kgs per day and at every end of month the demand is so high and this calls for attention.

loans.use: Inorder to match with the demand every end of month,she want to increase the number of cows slaughtered from the current 4 to 6

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS FARMING

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Nkurankan in Ghana is a large marking center for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Comfort M. is a resident of Nkurankan and sells fried fish in the market. She is also a client of the Kraban Support Foundation and is seeking a Kiva loan of $850.00 to help her improve and expand her business.

loans.use: Wants to expand fried fish market in Ghana.

loans.name: Oitutikhon

texts.ru:
B. Oitutikhon has been in business for the past 2 years and she is an active client of MLF MicroInvest. She delivers her goods by herself. She is married and has 3 children.. She needs $300 for purchasing seasonal merchandise. She is counting on receiving maximum profit from selling her merchandise and using the proceeds for her family’s needs.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Байпочоева Ойтутихон, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 2 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 2 лет. Товары привозит сама. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Ей необходимо 300$, для закупки сезонного товара. Она рассчитывает получить максимальную прибыль от продажи своих товаров и потратить их на нужды семьи.

loans.use: To increase sales turnover

loans.name: María Angela

texts.es:
Mrs. María Ángela H. is 31 years old, married and mother of 3 school-aged children. María’s greatest dream is that her children continue their studies and will culminate in one day attending college allowing them to obtain a better life. María has a store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her children and her home. She began her small business with financial support from her husband who has sold spare parts for automobiles for some time. The reason for starting the business was to increase the family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. María needs $50 loan to invest in the purchase of rice and pastas, which are the two most requested products by her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María Ángela H. tiene 31 años de edad está casada y madre de 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar. El mayor deseo de María es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y culminar algún día una carrera universitaria que les permita obtener un mejor nivel de vida. María tiene una despensa que atiende ella misma, además de cuidar a sus hijos y los trabajos cotidianos de la casa. Empezó su pequeño negocio hace 5 años con el apoyo económico de su marido quién se dedica a la venta de repuestos para automóviles desde hace mucho tiempo, la razón de ello fue la de ayudar a aumentar los ingresos de la casa, desde entonces ha ido creciendo gradualmente. María necesita un crédito de $ 50 para invertir en la compra de arroz y fideos que son los productos de mayor demanda por sus clientes.

loans.use:
Purchase of rice and pastas

compra de arroz y fideos

loans.name: Nixi Debeldy

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Nixi Debeldy. I work in commerce and I have a small grocery store called " MARELIN ". I have been running this store for one year. It generates an income to help with the family’s expenses. At present, I need to buy more merchandise in order to be able to offer a bigger variety of products to my clients. It is an important to mention that thanks to the income of this business my children are in school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Nixi Debeldy, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una pequeña pulperia llamada pulperia "MARELIN", tengo un año de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente nesesito surtir mas mi negocio y poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad de producto, Es importante mensionar que gracias a los ingresos de este negocio mis hijos estan estudiante.

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, flour, grains oil and milk products.

loans.name: Svetlan

texts.en: For several years, Svetlan B. worked in Germany to earn enough money to buy a bar in his native village. He is single and takes care of his elderly parents. The bar is going well but Svetlan still needs some money for equipment. The loan request is $750.

loans.use: To purchase equipment.

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary N. would like to buy more utensils for her business in order to supply all of her customers in the area.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To buy more utensils to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca T. S., 45,  is married and has 3 children. Rebecca sells peppers and has been running this business for the last 15 years.  According to Rebecca, she used to sell the peppers retail in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone. With the loans she received from SMT, Rebecca increased her stock and began selling wholesale. She has no problem meeting her children’s school expenses. Rebecca is happy and would like to expand the business.  She proudly said, “With a loan of Le. 2,000,000 ($700) I will be better off in the future because I will make a good and fast profit."

loans.use: To buy peppers to sell wholesale

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Mrs. Ouch S., 45, owns a plot of land on which she grows rice. She is also occasionally hired to harvest the crop in the neighboring field, normally earning $3 to $4 a day in profit. Her husband, Mr. Hak Choun, 46, is a police officer who earns less than $1 a day in profit. They have five children, all of whom are students. This couple hopes to use their Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seed and oil. To buy all of these, they are requesting a loan from Kiva of about $1,000. They will use the fertilizers and rice seed to farm in the dry seasons to gain more yields throughout the year.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase fertilizers, rice seed and oil.

loans.name: Mwahija

texts.en:
Mwahija is a married woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 3 years old. Mwahija has been selling clothing since 2002. Everyday, she works from 6am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

In the past, Mwahija has taken out onesuccessful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Mrs. Trinidad is an old client, and a very good one. She has worked with our institution for four years now. She was a member of a credit Group, and now she works with individual credit. She has never defaulted on any credit; rather, she is very punctual and responsible. Her husband is the owner of the vehicle she uses for work. She helps him with the maintenance on it and also works with the automobile. Also, she works as a domestic employee, and in this way she is able to help support her large family. She needs this credit now to improve their quality of life by installing needed electrical connections in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Trinidad es una Cliente antigua y muy buena, ella trabaja con nuestra institucion ya cuatro años, ella era miembro de un Grupo solidario, ahora trabaja con un Crédito Individual, no falló en ninguno de sus creditos, al contrario es muy puntual y responsable. Su esposo es dueño de la movilidad con la que trabaja, ella ayuda a él con el mantenimiento del mismo y tambien trabaja con el Automovil, ademas ella trabaja tambien como empleada doméstica, con lo cual ayuda a mantener a su numerosa familia. Ahora necesita el Crédito para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pues instalará en su casa las conexiones electricas necesarias.

loans.use: Maintenance on their taxi and the installation of electricity in their home.

loans.name: Kurbonmahmad

texts.ru:
Kurbonmahmad S. lives in Rudaki. He is 48 years old, married, and has 5 children. He has a technical education with a focus on accounting. In his spare time, he works with livestock. He doesn't have a large enough income to support his large family. He buys young bulls at the local market, feeds and cares for them until they grow, and sells them back for a small profit. The reason he needs the money is because of his present plans to buy another young bull to raise. He therefore decided to take a 12 month loan. >Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Шодиев Курбонмахмад житель района Рудаки. Возраст 48 лет, женат ,имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое.По специальности бухгалтер. В свободное от работы время клиент занимается животноводством. Так как заработная плата у него небольшая,содержать большую семью он не может. Курбонмахмад покупает на местном рынке молодых бычков,откармливает их и продает на рынке по более выгодной ему цене. Сейчас клиент планирует купить очередного бычка для откормки,ддля чего ему нужны деньги. Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев

loans.use: To buy another young bull

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mrs. Veasna H., 49, and her husband, Mr. Yorn Phai, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children, three sons and four daughters. One of the daughters is married and lives outside the family home, while the other three weave silk at home. All of their sons attend a local school.

Mrs. Veasna has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her mother. Mr. Yorn is also a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes their material to sell in Phnom Penh. They have three looms in the family's weaving business.

Mrs. Veasna is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase silk thread to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk thread for weaving.

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina, along with her husband, works hard to ensure that their two small children improve themselves each day by continuing their studies. For several years, she sold tubers -- such as potatoes -- door-to-door. However her activities, along with the other traveling salespeople in the area, were halted by the local municipal police given that house-to-house sales are prohibited. The end of her business led her to start selling sheep in the markets of Chupaca on the weekends. The rest of the days of the week, she works with her husband in a brick factory. With these activities, they manage to earn income to feed their children. Aquilina does not stop – her goal is to grow her livestock enterprise, for which she is seeking a loan that she will invest wisely into the purchase of additional sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Aquilina que trabaja junto a su esposo arduamente para ver a sus 2 pequeños hijos superarse cada día a través del estudio, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta ambulante de tubérculos como la papa. Pero fue desalojada por la policía municipal junto a los demás comerciante de su zona por la prohibición de venta ambulatoria. Para detenerse en su trabajo, empezó a dedicarse a la venta de ganado de ovejas en las ferias ganaderas de Chupaca, esto lo hace todos los fines de semana y los demás días, junto a su esposo, trabajan en una fabrica ladrillera. De esa manera ellos logran conseguir el pan a diario para sus hijos, Aquilina no se detiene, tiene como meta crecer en la ganadería, para lo cual solicita un préstamo que invertirá hábilmente en la compra de más ovejas.

loans.use: Purchase of more sheep to help increase her income.

loans.name: Petro

texts.en:
Petro is a businessman from the small town of Khoost, Western Ukraine. He offers transportation services in his home town and its vicinity. Petro's business is the main source of income for his family of four. He started this business 4 years ago. Presently, he's making $600 in net profit each month.

Petro is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas to install new type of running gear in his vehicle to reduce his running costs. He believes better quality equipment will help him have fewer repairs, glitches and less down-time. We believe Petro's focused approach to business and his diligent hard work will help him repay this loan on time and expand his business as a result.

loans.use: To install liquefied gas running gear in his vehicle

loans.name: Madeleine Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Madeleine pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en la Av. Universitaria  Mz.A Lt.22, distrito de Yarinacocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 40 años de edad, es madre de niñas menores de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al transporte terrestre, manejo un auto. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/.300, decide invertir en mantenimiento de jardines en diferentes viviendas, escuelas, etc.
 
En la actualidad continúa con el negocio de mantenimiento, ampliación, instalación y cuidado de áreas verdes, jardines. 

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 tijera podadora, 5 palas, 1 escalera y otros.

Madeleina es una mujer trabajadora y está feliz con todo lo que ha logrado y realizado.
texts.en:
Señora Madeleine belongs to the Las Brisas ("The Breezes") Communal Bank, located on Universitaria Ave, Mz.A Lt.22, in the Yarinacocha District of Ucayali Department. She is 40 years old, married and the mother of several girls who are still minors. Her husband works in transportation and drives a car. With Madeleine's first loan 0f 300 soles (US $100) from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in garden maintenance at a variety of homes and schools.

She is still involved in this business: she does garden installations, maintenance, expansion, and cares for gardens and green areas.

With this loan of 2,000 soles (US $675), which she will repay in four months, Madeleine will buy one pair of pruning shears, five shovels, a ladder and other items she needs for her work.

Madeleine is a hard-working woman, and is pleased with all that she has done and achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a ladder, pruning shears and shovels

loans.name: Nop

texts.en:
Mrs. Nop N. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pei Village in Kandal Province. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her household. Her husband, Mr. Mork Bun, is a fisherman in the local lake in the village. In his business, he now faces a small problem because his boat is too old and he cannot go to catch fish. Thus, his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy a new boat, and she will use the rest of the money to buy fishnets for her husband's business.

Mrs. Nop N. is 47 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in different business activities while two are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a new boat and fishnets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene  52 años, vive con sus 5 hijos y sus nietos, quienes trabajan todos en la chacra en mutuo acuerdo. Desde su infancia fue a los campos de cultivo, ahora con sus hijos continua la misma actividad. Cuando termina de trabajar en la chacra vende gaseosas, hace un mes que empezó, con el anhelo de que algún día, antes que muera, nos dice, pueda tener una pequeña bodega. A Nancy el trabajo agrícola ya le cansa mucho, es por ello que le gustaría tener una tienda para ya no trabajar en la chacra, piensa que el negocio no sería tan rentable, pero si tendría ingresos diarios. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Este dinero, es su oportunidad de comprar varios paquetes de gaseosas y golosinas para vender en mayor cantidad, por ello invertirá  todo el dinero en esto.
texts.en:
Nancy is 52 years old. She lives with her five children and her grandchildren who all work on the farm together. Since her infancy, she has gone to work in the fields and now with her children she continues the same activity. When she finishes working on the farm she sells soft drinks. She started a month ago with the longing that one day before she dies to have a small general store. The agricultural work makes Nancy very tired and for that reason she would like to have a store to not have to work on the farm. She doesn't think the business would be very profitable but she would have a daily income. This is the first time she is requesting a loan from MFP. This money is her opportunity to buy several cases of soft drinks and candy to sell in greater quantities and for that reason she will invest it all in this.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 49 años, es casada, tuvo 4 hijos, D. los cuales está viviendo solo con dos D. ellos. DesD. muy joven le ha gustado L. costura, es muy eficiente en L. reparación D. prendas, después D. visitar su taller D. costura L. ropa sale casi nueva; a elL. le gusta mucho su trabajo y no siente cansancio. Hace como 6 años también venD. golosinas, porque solo L. costura no le es tan rentable, ya que tiene que ganar para poder pagar el alquiler del local, por ahora no tiene dificultad alguna y sobre todo tiene muchos clientes seguros y conocidos. Es su 5to préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y es puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado ha decidido comprar materiales D. costura, tanto hilos, como cierres y botones.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old, married and had 4 children of whom two are living with her. She has liked to sew since she was very young, and is very good in the alteration of clothing. After being in her sewing shop, the clothes come out looking like new. She likes her work and does not tire. Since about 6 years ago she also sells sweets, because her sewing is not so profitable by itself and she has to earn income to pay the rent of the shop. She currently does not have a problem covering her expenses especially since she has many known and returning customers. This is her 5th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is on time with her payments. With the requested funds she has decided to purchase sewing materials, such as threads, zippers and buttons.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing materials.

loans.name: Marlith

texts.es:
La señora Marlith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas,” vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Tarapoto, ella  se dedica a la venta de  cosméticos de la marca de Esika sus ventas lo realiza a través de pedidos por catálogos. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en  6 meses, comprará  productos en oferta como colonias para damas caballeros y niños, labiales, esmaltes, joyas que son muy vendidos en estas fiestas de fin de año para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, ella requiere de capital por que un gran número de sus ventas son al crédito.
 
La señora Marlith tiene 34 años, vive con sus hijos y su esposo que es mecánico. Ella manifiesta que Manuela Ramos es un apoyo para ella y su familia, así como para las demás mujeres emprendedoras, ella trabaja duro cada día por que quiere crecer en su negocio y ver a sus hijos profesionales.
texts.en:
Marlith S. V. is a member of "Always United" Siempre Unidas communal bank. She lives in the San Martín region, in the province and district of Tarapoto. She sells Esika brand cosmetics. She orders her cosmetics through catalogues. With this loan of 1,500 soles, which she will repay in six months, she will buy products like colognes for women, men, and children, lipstick, nail polish, and jewelry. These products are popular and sell well in the end of the year festivals. In order to satisfy the needs of her customers, Marlith requires the loan because a great number of her sales are in credit. Marlith is 34 years old and lives with her sons and her husband who is a mechanic. She expresses that Field Partner Manuela Ramos offers support to her and her family, as well as for other women entrepeneurs. She works hard every day because she wants to grow her business and see her children become working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy diverse products like cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Inocente

texts.es: El señor Inocente T. labora para una empresa de bebidas muy conocida en la cual tiene una antigüedad de 6 años tal que brindo muy buenas referencias laborales ya que explican que es una persona muy responsable dentro y fuera de su trabajo, el señor inocente esta tramitando este crédito para el pago de la colegiatura y uniforme de su hija ya que el le quiere brindar un mejor futuro mediante una buena profesión.
texts.en:
Inocente T. has worked for a well-know refreshments company for six years. He has good work references who state that he is a very responsible person both at work and in his personal life. Inocento is asking for this loan to pay his daughter's high school tuition and uniform as he wants her to have a good career so that she will have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's high school tuition and uniform.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: la sra Ernestina reside en laureles sur en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 44 años de edad, dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad, su esposo es contratista, doña Ernestina vende carne de res y inicio con prestamos en financieras.con esta solicitud es para la inversión de compra de carnes para ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus ricas carne de res, también va hacer sopas para vender los fines de semana para generar otros ingresos que compra el carnic. La vende ambulante y en su casa. Sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa, poder apoyar a sus hijos a que concluyan sus estudios,  así como hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ernestina lives in the area of South Laureles in the City of Managua. She is 44 years old and she has two children that are 14 and 18. Her husband is a contractor and she sells beef. She was able to start her business because she was able to get loans. She is asking for a new loan so that she will be able to invest in the purchase of fresh meats so that she will be able to offer a greater variety of meats to her customers. She is also going to sell soups on the weekends so she can create more income which she will use to purchase more meat. She is an ambulatory salesperson. Her plan is to be able to finish building her house and to support her two children so that they can finish their studies. She also want to make her business grow.

(Translated by Jian of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beef

loans.name: Lina Estela

texts.es:
Lina  es socia del Banco Comunal 30 de junio.
Lina es soltera, tiene 26 años y vive con sus padres, Lina junto a su mama tienen una tienda en donde venden abarrotes en general, bebidas, helados, realizan recargas virtuales, actividad que realiza todos los días en sus tiempos libres, Lina es estudiante de Ingeniería Química.
Lina necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas y recargas virtuales.
Los sueños de Lina son culminar sus estudios, ejercer su profesión y llevar sus padres de vacaciones.
texts.en:
Lina is a member of the June 30th Communal Bank. She is a single 26 year old and she lives with her parents. Lina and her mother have a store where they sell general groceries, drinks, ice cream, and virtual refills of cellphone minutes. She works every day in her free time and is also studying chemical engineering. Lina needs a loan of $325 that will be used to purchase phone cards and virtual refills for the store. Lina dreams of finishing her studies, practicing her profession, and taking her parents on vacations.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase phone cards and virtual refills

loans.name: Ubaydullohon

texts.ru: Убайдуллохон сотрудничает с МикроИнвест уже 2 года. Он арендует часть помещения в большом универмаге и продает продукты питания. Ему 26 лет, не женат. Проживает с родителями. Товар приобретает на оптовом рынке за 100 километров от дома и здесь же на местных рынках. Убайдуллохон хочет добавить в ассортимент своих товаров еще несколько наименований и подал заявку на получение займа.
texts.en:
Ubaydullohon has been in collaboration with MicroInvest for two years now. He rents part of a space in a large supermarket and sells food. He is 26 years old and not married. He lives with his parents. He gets his merchandise on the wholesale market 100 kilometers from his home as well as on the local markets. Ubaydullohon wants to add new items to the assortment of his goods and has applied for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Goma Thapa

texts.en:
Mrs. Goma Thapa M. is a resident of Sainbu-Bhashipati, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and one granddaughter. Her husband, Mr. Kamal Bahadur Thapa, is a retired officer. Her son is a land broker.

Mrs. Goma’s daughter-in-law is a beautician. She has completed the training to be a beautician. Now she wants to open her own beauty salon but, due to lack of funds, she cannot open her own beauty salon. So her mother-in-law Mrs. Goma Thapa M. is requesting a Rs 25000.00 loan to help her daughter-in-law open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: To open beauty salon

loans.name: Hayssam

texts.en: Hayssam is a 40 year old married man living in Ghobeiry, Mount Lebanon. He owns a men's clothing store that he started on his own in the beginning of 2009 after having 3 years of experience in the field. Today, Hayssam is requesting to borrow $1,000 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To install plumbing in her home

loans.name: Rosalia Rosario

texts.es: Rosalia tiene 44 años de edad, actualemente esta soltera, tiene 2 hijas, pero ninguna depende ella. La vivienda donde vive es propia, pero no cuenta con un documento de respaldo. Rosalia se dedica a la venta de golosinas, como ser caramelos, galletas, chocolates, etc. Y aprovenchando que el mismo esta ubicado al campus universitario, mas propiamente frente a las carreras de medicina y bioquímica, vende tambien artículos tales como guantes, jeringas y otros. Se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo atras. Cerca de su puesto de venta no existen otros negocios similares, por lo tanto no existe mucha competencia. El destino del credito es para capital de operacion, es decir para compra de mercaderia para poder surtir su negocio. Es el tercer credito al que accede Rosalia, siempre mostró un excelente comportamiento en los dos anteriores créditos. No presenta antecedentes negativos en el sistema financiero.
texts.en:
Rosalia is 44, and she is currently single. She has two daughters, but they are not dependents. The house where she lives is hers, but she does not have the documents to support this. Rosalia sells sweets like candies, cookies, and chocolates, etc. Because she takes advantage of her location, which is on a university campus in front of the medicine and biochemistry sections, she also sells gloves, syringes, and other things. She has been doing this for a long time. There are no other similar businesses near hers. Therefore, there is not much competition. The loan is for working capital to buy merchandise to stock her business. This is Rosalia’s third loan. She demonstrated excellent behavior with her two previous loans. There has not been any negative behavior on her part in the financial system.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma R. already has a plantation but she needs money to buy equipment to run it and to improve it. She is 47 years old and married with five children. She has had three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public, three 3 days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 150 Tala (~$56 US). SPBD loans are Thelma’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed killing spray, chemicals, chain saw, bush knives, filings and some spades

loans.name: Olga Elisea

texts.es: Doña Olga Elisea, es una persona de escasos recursos y huerfana que  trabajaba en oficios domesticos y a traves de esfuerzos a venido superando en los estudios, desea seguir superando a traves de sus estudios universitario por lo que acude a la Asociaciòn para un prestamo para los gastos de estudios, y ella ve la necesidad de estos gastos que no cuenta; para ser una persona competitiva y a la vez sea de provecho para mantener sus dos hijas a traves de esta supereaciòn.
texts.en:
Olga Elisea is a person with scarce resources. She is an orphan who does domestic work. With effort, she has been excelling in her studies. She wants to continue doing well in her university studies. That is why she has come to the Asociación to ask for a loan for educational expenses. She needs the money to pay the necessary expenses to allow her to fulfill her ambitions and support her two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 20-year-old man living with his parents. He has been working as a construction worker since 2006 to provide, along with his brothers, adequate living conditions for the family.

Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more tools so he can develop his work and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy more tools to develop his work

loans.name: Melva

texts.es: La señora Melva, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Laureles II”, Distrito de Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y 02 hijos que aun depende de ella.Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. Melva, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.

loans.use: Comprará mas abarrotes, para aumentar sus productos.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is 55 years old, married to Carmelita and they are residing in Annayatan, Enrile, Cagayan. The couple preferred to engage in the livestock business.  They raise hogs and native chickens as their source of income.  Aside from this, they also manage a small farm lot.  

Jesus wanted to borrow loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP5, 000 that will serve as additional capital to maintain their livestock business.  The amount will be used to purchased feeds supply for the growth and health of their hogs and chicken. 

Jesus said that only through patience and hard work, one can be successful. Jesus and his wife are not just patient but also both working hard to reach out their goals in life. Jesus has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns double income every time he sells his raised livestock.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia B., a 50-year-old vendor from Pasay City, has been selling golf balls in front of the golf course where her husband works. She earns 10,000 PHP a month, but sales are low on rainy days because players will not play on a muddy driving range. Her husband, Constantino, 51, works as a caddy at the golf course. They have two adult children. Nelia sets up a plastic table to sell her items every day. She has been in this business for the last five years.

Nelia became a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006. She is now on her thirteenth loan cycle with the cooperative. Nelia is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP as additional capital for her business. It has always been her desire to have a happy family in spite of living in poor conditions.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response to poverty and social injustice. It is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. CCT serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: For additional business capital

loans.name: Maria Yris

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal San Judas Tadeo.
Maria es casada, tiene 54 años, cuatro hijos que son mayores,  el último esta en la Universidad.
Maria empezó hace 20 años en su casa con una ferretería pero era muy pesado para ella, su esposo había trabajado por varios años en una vidriería, al renunciar pensó en poner en su casa un negocio familiar en sociedad con su hermano, ahora tienen una vidriería.
María cocina por las mañanas y lleva el almuerzo a los trabajadores y se queda atendiendo en la vidriaría. 
Necesita un crédito D. 2000 soles, va comprar vidrios directo al proveedor.
Tiene 13 años en Finca Perú ha crecido en su negocio y ha podido adquirir mas materiales, sus hijos trabajan con ella.
Su sueño es independizarse por que esta en sociedad con su cuñado

loans.use: vidrios directo al proveedor

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine U. is now 35 years old and happily married to her partner in life Francis U., who is 36 years old and currently working as an office clerk. They were blessed with 3 children: Franz Joseph, 8 years old; Tricialinne, 5 years old; and Nicole, 2 years old. According to Josephine, she wants to save for the education of her children while her children are not spending too much for their education today. So even though her husband has a salary from his work, she finds alternative ways to earn income. This was why she started her variety store business that has been running for 1 year now.

When she joined the Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), she used the loan that she received to buy things that she needed for her business. Now her loan will also be used to buy necessary things for the improvement of her business.

One hope of Josephine's is that through their perseverance, and with the help of ASHI, they will change the life that they have right now.

loans.use: To finance her variety store business

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia A. E. de 55 años de edad vive en Santa Tecla municipio del departamento de La Libertad, junto a sus dos nietos Eduardo de 10 años y Fabiola de 13 años de edad, también la acompaña en el hogar su esposo don Mario quien se dedica a trabajar como sastre. Los ingresos mensuales de don Mario apenas alcanzan los $200 US, es por ello que María hace seis años tomo la decisión de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, montando ella su propio negocio donde vende ropa y zapatos, el crédito que ahora solicita es para surtir el mismo ya que desea aprovechar la época navideña, donde muchos clientes recurren a su negocio.
texts.en:
María Julia A. E. is 55 years old and lives in the town of Santa Tecla in the department of La Libertad. Her two grandchildren Eduardo (age 10) and Fabiola (age 13) live with her. Her husband, Don Mario, is a tailor who earns a monthly income of $200 USD. For this reason, María made the decision six years ago to help her husband with the household expenses by starting her own business selling clothes and shoes.

She is now requesting a loan to buy inventory for her store so that she can take advantage of the Christmas season. During this time, many customers return to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory for the holiday season

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita, 50 years old, occupies herself with farming. She cultivates rice. She helps her husband Diosdado maintain their farm. She keeps an eye out for weeds and immediately stops them from growing. She joined CEVI in order to gain access to its financial services. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000. She will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other supplies needed at her farm. This loan will help Teresita improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: purchasing seeds, fertilizer and other supplies needed at her farm

loans.name: Caminando Hacia El Progreso 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Sofia, 60, is a borrower who lives near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Caminando Hacia el Progreso (Walking Towards Progress), and her story is representative of the other borrowers in the group.

Sofia lives in El Puerto, a small town north-west of San Pedro. She has two children, one of whom still lives at home with her husband. They live in a house made from cement blocks with a tin roof, a significant improvement over the wooden houses of many neighbors. Sofia has used profits from her colmado (small corner store) to build this house, a significant achievement and proof of an expanding business. El Puerto is not an easy place to live: few medical facilities, large distances to nearest towns, little access to electricity, and no potable water access can cripple a population. Despite these difficulties, Sofia and her group have found stability in their loans and look forward to continuing to develop their businesses and community.

Sofia will be using this loan, her ninth with Esperanza International, to buy additional merchandise for her store, including bread, juices and soft drinks. She said that before having loans, it was easy for her and other group members to fail in their businesses because they did not have enough cash flow. Now, however, she and the others in her group have thriving businesses. She is very grateful for past support and excited for the possibilities in the future. Thank you for lending to Sofia and the Caminando Hacia el Progreso group!

loans.use: To buy bread, juices and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Ana Santusa

texts.es:
La señora Ana es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Bárbara 2” desde hace 1 año atrás, del distrito de Chucuito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 06 hijos, de ellos 3 están a su lado. Ella estudió secundaria incompleta, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Ana nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, lo que le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más lana e hilos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia y su tienda de artesanías. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad de las socias y las promotoras, para cada reunión.
texts.en:
Ana has been a member of the Santa Barbara 2 communal bank for 1 year, which is located in the district of Chucuito, province and state of Puno. She is 45 years old, lives with her partner, and has 6 children, 3 of whom live with her. She did not complete secondary school. She sells handicrafts for a living. Ana tells us that with her first loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement, for 500 soles, she increased her capital and purchased more wool and string. She is requesting a loan for 500 soles which she will use to buy baize and wool. Her dream for the future is to have her own home and handicrafts shop. What she likes best about the communal bank is the punctuality of the members and facilitators for each meeting.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool, baize, and string

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her cafe/restaurant

loans.name: Rufine Biowa

texts.fr: Z. Rufine Biowa est née le 14 Juin 1968 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a une dizaine d’année que Rufine Biowa s’est installée à PK 10 Marina, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à TOSSOU Célestin, Rufine Biowa est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais quatre des enfants sont à sa charge et vivent ensemble avec son mari et elle. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Rufine Biowa n’a pas été à l’école. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Rufine Biowa mène comme activité, la vente de divers produits (pâtes alimentaires, sucre, lait, sardine, conserves de tomate, biscuits, huile, etc.) à son domicile. Rufine Biowa vend également des céréales (riz, etc.), ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenus. Il y a près de 7 ans que Rufine Biowa exerce cette activité. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Rufine Biowa se ravitaille. Rufine Biowa a bien remboursé les crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. Rufine Biowa souhaite augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et mieux répondre aux différents besoins de ses clients. Cependant, Rufine Biowa ne réunit pas assez de fonds pour renforcer son activité. C’est pourquoi Rufine Biowa sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un autre crédit.
texts.en:
Z. Rufine Biowa was born on June 14, 1968 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Rufine Biowa settled ten years ago in PK10 Marina, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. Married to TOSSOU Célestin, Rufine Biowa is the mother of five children, all in school. Four of the children are supported by and live with her and her husband. The couple supports the family together. In order to pay her various expenses, Rufine Biowa runs a business selling diverse products (pasta, sugar, milk, sardines, canned tomatoes, cookies, oil, etc.) from her home. She also sells grain (rice, etc.), which allows her to have several income sources. Rufine Biowa has been in this business for seven years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Rufine Biowa has fully repaid the loans she has received from ALIDé. Rufine Biowa would like to increase her stock of products and better respond to her customers' different needs. However, she does not have enough capital to build up her business. That is why Rufine Biowa is seeking another loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pasta, sardines, milk, sugar, peanut oil, and rice

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Muy deliciosos son catalogados los alimentos que con mucho ahínco prepara la señora Marcela T. en el departamento de León donde son vendidos a diario logrando alcanzar gran variedad de clientes.
Está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos, ella comprará tomate, cebolla, carne, salsas, chiltoma, entro otros. Con el crédito logrará continuar en su negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos y así obtendrá los ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
The food prepared very eagerly by señora Marecla T., in the Department of León, is classified as "very delicious." She sells her food in León every day, which allows her to reach a large mix of customers. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials to make her food; among the food she will purchase will be tomato, onion, meat, sauces and sweet pepper. With the loan, she will be able to continue her business making and selling food, and therefore she will have the income necessary to support her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials to make food

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth D. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a sari-sari (general) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Janeth joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Janeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin P., 41, lives in a rural area of the province of Siem Reap. She and her husband currently make a daily income of $5 per day working as porters in the fish market. The couple has five children who are single; most of them are not long in school. To help respond to the family's needs, two of their children work as porters at the same place.
