The family has been building their house for a long time but the construction process is never completed. That is why P. has decided to seek a loan to buy housing equipment to finish building their new house.

loans.use: To buy housing equipment to finish building their new house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 63 years old, married to Gicheha Muhuha and has five children.  She has practiced farming in Njabini town for the last 20 years.

She is among the first members to join KADET and this is her seventh year with the organization.  She has successfully applied for six loans, which she paid well and on time.  This will be her seventh loan and she plans to use the money to buy fertilizer for her farm and a dairy cow to diversify her income stream.

Since Njabini is in rural Kenya, majority of the people rely on farming as a source of income.  She, therefore, hopes to use technology in the future to increase her yield and become a reliable supplier of farm products.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a cow

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: el sr. Bernardino S. se dedica a dar el servicio de moler maiz y tambien vende leña, cuenta con un molino. Tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y se ve que le ha ido muy bien, ya que con los ingresos de su negocio suple las necesidades de su familia. El no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para realizar mantenimiento y cambio de piezas de su molino. el credito lo utilzara para comprar los repuestos y asi poder darle un buen mantenimiento a su molino y de esta manera brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bernardino provides corn grinding services and also sells firewood. He has one grinder, and has been doing this for four years. Things have been going well for him and he is able to provide for his family with the income from this activity, but he does not have the necessary working capital to be able to provide maintenance and spare parts for his grinder. He will use the money from this loan to buy the necessary spare parts and be able to maintain his grinder. In this way, he will be able to better serve his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts

loans.name: Lourdes' Group

texts.en:
Lourdes V. is from the village of Brgy. Common, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Lourdes is 57 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Lourdes joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business

loans.name: Burmabubu's Group

texts.en:
Burmabubu M. is the leader of this group. She is 51 and married. Her husband is a school teacher. Burmabubu has raised five children: three sons and two daughters. Her daughters are married and have, therefore, moved out. The tradition in Krygyzstan is that when a woman marries a man she leaves her parents' house to live with her new husband's family—unless they have enough money to get a place of their own. Burmabubu's sons have also left home to work in Bishkek. 


Burmabubu has been farming, fattening and reselling cattle for 30 years. Her husband helps her in this activity, even though teaching takes up most of his time. In this way they are able to make an additional 1700 soms ($37) a month. This made it possible for Burmabubu to build a house and contribute to the marriage of her daughters. With the loan, she will buy calves to increase the number of their cattle. In the future, Burmabubu plans to save money and contribute to her sons' weddings.

Damira B. is 59 and is married. She has three sons and three daughters. In order to make money, Damira and her husband have been fattening and reselling cattle for 30 years. In this way, they earn 6,000 soms ($130.74) per month. Damira started this business activity with an initial investment of 2,800 soms ($61).  Now she is applying for a loan to purchase calves. 

Dariya K. is 41 and is divorced. She has four sons. The younger son works in Bishkek while the others help Dariya with housework. In order to make money, Dariya fattens and resells cattle. She also sells milk. She makes 11,700 soms ($254.96) a month. Dariya wants to get a loan to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock.

Orozgul M. is 47 and is married. She has two daughters and a son. The older daughter works in Bishkek while the others are students. 30 years ago, Orozgul inherited a cow. Therefore she sells milk and resells cattle. She makes 3,000 soms ($65.37) a month. With the loan, Orozgul plans to buy cement for the construction of the shed.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase calves to increase her cattle population

loans.name: Bring Ambercourt To Unite Group [Bamu], Jinja

texts.en:
Being a security guard in a Ugandan metropolis means many things. First and foremost, it means sacrificing nighttime sleep, doing without respite hours and not having enough time for family. That was the exact experience M. Dan went through before he called it quits and started his five-year-old business selling chapati (unleavened flatbread, similar to tortillas) in Amber Court Market in Jinja.

For this single 24-year-old, it was time to cast his mind to the future. Dan knew he had to extricate himself out of this problem. His decision to take up this business was based partly on the fascination Ugandans have with chapati rolled egg omelets and the fact that he needed to find a stable and more convincing livelihood. 

For the last five years, Dan has shown resilience in stemming the tide of financial and other challenges to his fledgling business that have cropped up. His hard work has been paying dividends as he has been making profits close to 30,000 shillings a week. With his determination the future looks promising.

Dan is planning on expanding his business through the purchase of more bags of chapati baking flour with the assistance of this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of baking flour to make more chapatis

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty is very welcoming. She is 58 years old and sells building materials, assorted paints, nails, carpentry tools, door fixtures etc. to customers in her neighborhood in Kumasi. Gifty has been operating her trade for six years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to use this loan to add the sale of plywood to expand her product line. It is the dream of almost every Ghanaian to own his house which makes selling building materials profitable. Gifty believes in customer care and her broad smile almost always draws customers to her shop, making her one of the successful traders in these products.

Gifty is married to a man who is an auto mechanic and together they have five children from age 9 – 29 years. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profit that she will be able to support her children to achieve higher education.

loans.use: To purchase plywood for resale

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea N. is an elderly man. His wife appears on the left of the photo at their house. Chea N. works as a requirement laborer who is hired by people to carry firewood for fee. He also assists his wife in cultivating rice and vegetable crops when he is free from his job. The couple is blessed to four children: two are already married and others are single. Recently, their crops required fertilizer; however, Chea N. doesn’t have enough money to buy fertilizer to grow his crops. For this reason Chea N. has decided to ask a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow his crops.

loans.name: Tesorito De Oro - Ocongate Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TESORITO D. ORO - OCONGATE”; Los socios viven en el distrito D. Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia D. Quispicanchis departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Mariza ella tiene 27 años D. edad y La socia es natural D. Ocongate y es conviviente, su conyugue es mecánico  y venD. lubricantes para autos,  ella tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela pública D. Ocongate; La socia alterna sus actividades con la crianza D. animales menores, ella compra animales menores (cuyes, aves D. corral, chanchos); Ella compra los cría engorda y venD. los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores y así incrementar su negocio para tener mayor entrada. 

Los otros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como tienda D. abarrotes, artesanía, agricultura, ganadería, venta D. ropa, florería, taxistas, venta D. quesos, artefactos. Las sociasSonia y Felipa, estaban presentes pero no quisieron salir en esta foto por motivos D. creencias ancestrales, ellas creen que cuando se les saca una foto ellos pierden un poco el alma.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este les permitirá crecer y mejorar su  negocio y D. este mismo modo mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Tesorito D. Oro – Ocongate” communal bank. They live in the district of Ocongate, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis, Cusco department. Mariza is 27 years old, is from Ocongate, and lives with her husband. Her husband is a mechanic and he sells lubricants for cars. She has 2 children who are studying in the public school in Ocongate. She alternates her household activities with raising small livestock. She buys small animals (guinea pigs, domestic fowl, pigs), fattens them, and sells them. She is requesting a loan to buy small animals and expand her business so she can have more income. The other members work in different businesses, such as small grocery stores, crafts, agriculture, cattle raising, clothing sales, floristry, taxis, cheese sales, and antiques sales. The members value and are infinitely grateful for the loan granted to them since it will allow them to grow and improve their businesses, and thereby improve their quality of life. They promise to make their payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals for fattening so she can increase her business and have more income

loans.name: Buyanja Promotion B Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
This very determined and hardworking lady is not afraid of diversity when speaking in economic, lucrative business terms and of anything that can earn her a profit. A. Getrude, aged 53 years, is a happily married lady of five children and has been in the produce business for over twenty years. She grows food crops like beans, maize, coffee and bananas in Buyanja, Rukungiri, which has always earned her 300,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.

This loan is to help Getrude purchase manure for her plantation as she looks at diversifying her business.  This is because she did not have sound capital at the beginning. This will give her a free ticket to earn more revenue and cater for her family’s basic needs and also acquire a self-sustaining life as she hopes to open up a big supplies store to sell her produce.

loans.use: To buy manure for her plantation

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit B. is married with two children. After graduating the Conservatory in 1988 she moved with her husband to Siberia for work purposes and was involved in the perfume trade. In 2004, she returned to Armenia and started a clothing trade in one of the city markets. Anahit has applied for the loan in order to travel to the neighboring country to purchase new clothing stock.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing stock.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La Sra. Marlene vive  en la localidad de la Guardia distante a 20 km de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en el barrio 8 de diciembre, su esposo es de profesión mecánico, ella se dedica a la venta de lubricantes de vehículo, vive en casa en alquiler, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, el destino del crédito es para comprar mercadería para el negocio comprar una variedad de aceites , es nacida en la localidad de Camiri, provincia Cordillera del Departamento de Santa Cruz, la Sra. Es muy responsable y trabajadora, le ayuda también a su esposo en el taller mecánico, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el poyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Marlene lives in the La Guardia settlement, located 20 km away from the town of Santa Cruz, in the 8 de Diciembre (December 8th) neighborood. Her husband is a mechanic, while she sells vehicle lubricants. They live in a house they rent, and they have three children of school age. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products for her activity, notably a variety of motor oils. A native of Camiri, a settlement located in the Cordillera province of the Santa Cruz region, Marlene is very responsible and hard-working, also helping out her husband in his garage; she is very grateful to this institution for the support she received through the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vehicle lubricants and motor oils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 15 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nyamtseren

texts.en: Nyamtseren T. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two adult daughters in Hovd province of Mongolia. His daughters, ages 21 and 20, both attend university. In 2000, he began his business of selling clothes, with help of his wife, and has since managed to increase his working capital. His earnings have enabled him to purchase an apartment for his family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Nyamtseren hopes to continue expanding his business and save money for his children's future education. He is an honest and well disciplined man. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase new season's clothes for the upcoming autumn months in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase new season's clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single woman living with her two sisters. For the past three years, she has been running a clothing and lingerie store. Her business income is vital to support her family and to get a good life situation. 

She has obtained a previous loan through Kiva and she is very thankful for her decision. Now she is requesting a new, larger $2,000 loan through Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory. This loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she hopes to sell shoes in addition to clothes at her store.

loans.use: To expand her store’s inventory

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Corao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Dionicia; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella vende toda clase de artesanía como chompas,collares,mantas,chalinas y pantalones, en una feria que se realiza los días martes y jueves en el distrito de Corao que queda a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m.la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesanía como mantas y toda clase de textiles.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dionicia, 39, is divorced and has two children.  She is a member of the “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTI DE CCORAO” communal bank located in Corao district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She alternates her daily chores with crafts sales.  She sells all kinds of crafts like: sweaters, bracelets, blankets, scarves and pants in a market that takes place every Tuesday and Thursday in Corao district which is 20 minutes from the city of Cusco.

She works from 8am until 4pm.  She wants to expand her business and is asking for funds to buy more crafts, like blankets and all kinds of textiles.

She is grateful to all those who share in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy crafts like blankets and all kinds of textiles.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La Señorita Irma tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de dos niñas de edad escolar, vive en la compañía Cerro Real, en su domicilio posee una despensa bien surtida, en el barrio es la única despensa la mayoría de sus cliente son sus vecinos.
 La señorita Irma trabaja  muy bien en su negocio no obstante le falta algunas mercaderías de primera necesidad que les pide sus clientes, es por la razón que solicita un prestamos a la fundación y Kiva y a la vez agradece por el apoyo obtenido.
Desea comprar productos como ya que son los más consumidos: fideos, arroz, harina, y otros.
texts.en:
Irma is 29 years old.  She is a single mother and has two school-age daughters.  She lives in Cerro Real.  In her home she has a well-stocked grocery store.  Hers is the only grocery store in her neighborhood and most of her customers are neighbors.

Irma works very well in her business but she lacks some basic merchandise which her customers are requesting.  This is why she is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.  She is grateful for the support she is receiving.

She would like to buy those products which are most frequently consumed such as noodles, rice, flour and others.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as noodles, rice, bakery products, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina M. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child who is in school.  Madina has a business as a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Madina sells her products in her shop at retail prices.     

Madina has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids. The main business challenge(s) for Madina include the rainy season and the ever increasing prices of cosmetics. Her goals and aspirations for her business is to own bridal salon and also to build her own house.   

Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics, braids and hair relaxers

loans.name: Robie Jane

texts.en:
Robie Jane P., age 27, sells ready-to-wear clothes and ukay-ukay (second-hand) clothing items in the local community. Robie Jane has been engaged in her business for over two years and it brings her approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. She lives in the village of Barangay 24, Gingoog City, and has two school-aged children. 

Earlier this year, Robie Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Robie Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and employed as working capital. Robie Jane is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase T-shirts, blouses, and other additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Robie Jane from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase T-shirts, blouses, and other additional products to sell

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Anastacia Lidia de 36 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y forma parte del grupo “Fortaleza”, formado por 10 integrantes, todos ellos residentes de la zona de Raúl Porras Barrenechea en el distrito de Carabayllo.

Hace siete años la Sra. Lidia se dedica a la administración y atención de su bodega la cual esta ubicada en su domicilio en un pequeño espacio ambientado para éste negocio., Empezó vendiendo sólo gaseosas, luego pudo invertir un poco de su capital en cervezas y poco a poco fue agregando golosinas, abarrotes y  aumentando muchísimo más el stock de bebidas.
Gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido hacerse cargo del pago de estudios de su hija.
Una de sus metas es poner un Taller de costura.
El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de bebidas para surtir su bodega.
texts.en: Mrs. Anastacia Lidia, age 36, has two children and is part of the Fortaleza ["Strength"] group. The group has 10 members, all residents of the Raúl Porras Barrenechea zone in the Carabayllo district. For seven years Mrs Lidia has worked in her store, which is located in a small space in her home outfitted for the store. When she began, she sold only pop, and later she was able to invest a bit of her capital in beer. Bit by bit she has been accumulating candy and groceries, and increasing her stock of drinks greatly. Thanks to her work, she has been able to take over paying for her daughter's studies. One of her goals is to open a sewing workshop.  She will use the requested loan to invest in the purchase of drinks to stock her store.

loans.use: to be invested in the purchase of drinks to increase stock

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is the wife of T. D. and she lives in a city called Okara in Pakistan. She owns a two-room house there and lives with her family in the area named Sheikh Basti. Zarina is 40 years old, a very caring mother and a wife. She manages her responsibilities very well by staying at home. She makes the utmost effort to provide ease to her family. She is fond of cooking and cooks delicious and healthy food for her family. 

Her husband is involved in a construction supplies selling business. He runs a shop in the market where he offers construction supplies like cement, bricks, sand, etc. to his customers. He mainly receives orders from the building constructors and earns good income by fulfilling them on time. He has been in this business for many years and is known among his clients for his quality products. 

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies in bulk to put in his shop for selling. Zarina is hopeful that her husband’s financial condition will be improved after making this investment in his business. 

Note: In the photo, Zarina is the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: To buy more supplies for a construction supplies selling business

loans.name: Yem Sam Ann's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem S. A. was born in 1972. Her husband, Mr. Phan Ry, and she have four children. Two are workers, and two are students who also help support their parents in their business. They live in Srei Snam village in Kandal province.

Mrs. Yem S. A. and her husband are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land and rent four hectares more from villagers for cultivating rice. Aside from farming, they also conduct a rice business.

Twenty-two people make up this village bank loan, and Mrs. Yem S. A. was selected to be the bank president by the other members. The members of this village loan will use their portions to support different purposes.

In order to support their rice business, Mrs. Yem S. A. is asking for a loan to buy more rice to enlarge her current business. With their loan they hope to increase their income to improve their family’s living condition.

loans.use: To buy more rice to enlarge her rice business

loans.name: Naransaruulzaya

texts.en: Naransaruulzaya, 32, is divorced and lives with her parents, younger brother and her child in Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her parents are retired and her brother attends a local secondary school. Naransaruulzaya makes and sells traditional clothing in cooperation with her mother. Her mother worked as a tailor before she retired. She grew up watching her mother sew clothes and it helped her a lot to become a seamstress and gave her experience to begin her business. They have regular customers and mostly make traditional clothing to order. They want to expand their business and operate a bigger workshop, so that they can take in more work. Naransaruulzaya is a hardworking person who says, "I want to expand my business and have a workshop with 4 or 5 employees." She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy a couple of new sewing machines and more material for the business.

loans.use: To buy a couple of new sewing machines

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. T. is from the village of San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 45 years old. Delia is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Delia owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Delia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Delia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-San Francisco, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ruffa

texts.en: Ruffa is a 20-year-old single woman who supports her family by operating a hog-raising business. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Ruffa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ruffa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase hog feed so that she can continue to save up for future for business expansion. Ruffa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Pachaquiej Beya Group

texts.es:
Armando Yovani C. A., es casado, tiene 32 años de edad, cursos los seis años de educación primaria, se dedica al comercio a la reventa de ropa, tiene 6 años de experiencia con este oficio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que se dedica a oficios domesticos, quiere solicitar un préstamo para ampliación de su capital de trabajo, ya que va a comprar mas ropa para su reventa; por esta razón decide organizar un grupo con el fin de solicitar el préstamo. Los integrantes del grupo se dedican a diferentes oficios productivos como: Servicio de arrerradero, albañileria, contadora de un establecimiento educativo. 

Esperan que con el préstamo logren mejorar sus ingresos y la condicion de vida de cada uno de los integrantes
texts.en:
Armando Yovani C. A. is married, 32 years old, and he has a grade six education. He has a clothing business and he has six years' experience in the field. He has his wife's support. She is a housewife.  He wishes to request a loan to supplement his working capital funds, to purchase more clothing for resale. This is the reason why he decided to organize a group and to request a loan. The members of the group have different businesses, such as: lumber services, carpenter, and educational institution accountant. 

They hope that the loan will help them improve their income and the quality of life of each of the members.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily C. is from the village of Thailand, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 41 years old. Emily is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap, and biscuits in the local community. Emily has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Emily joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emily has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Emily is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods, beverages & detergents. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Emily from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, beverages & detergents

loans.name: Geneva

texts.en:
Geneva is a 43-year-old single mother of three children who rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. After separating from her husband, she decided to venture into cloth-selling to be able to support her family. Geneva has been in the textile business for fifteen years now. She started with capital of 500,000 shillings and now she has three million. Geneva’s business challenge is her limited capital. 

Geneva is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell. In the future, her dream is to own her own boutique and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia nació en la comunidad D. Arin departamento Cusco (Perú), tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y fruto D. relación bonita sus ocho hijos, quien son el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. 

Los verdes campos D. la comunidad D. Arin, ubicado en la Valle Sagrado D. los Incas donD. actualmente vive, han sido en la vida D. Aurelia un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. DesD. muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja junto a su pareja, que con mucho esmero siembran hortalizas como por ejemplo papa, maíz y otras vegetales. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que su arduo trabajo ha sido D. mucho provecho. Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros D. acopio situados en las ciudades D. Urubamba y Cusco. Aurelia también se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, chanchos y gallinas.  Aurelia solicita el préstamo para realizar unos D. sus planes, que es incrementar la crianza D. animales menores como por ejemplo gallinas y cuyes. Ella tiene la obligación D. pagar sus aportes puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo si desea acceder a otro crédito. Agradece a la institución por concederle el préstamo. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará gallinas blancas y semillas y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Aurelia was born in Arin community, in Cusco department, Peru.  She is 41 years old and a very cheerful and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home together with her partner and their eight children who are the motivation behind all her efforts.

The green fields of Arin community (which is located in the Sacred Valley of the Incas and is where Aurelia currently lives) have been a pleasant place for Aurelia to work over the years.  Her parents taught her to farm when she was very young and now she has her own farmland where she works together with her partner.  With a lot of care, they grow vegetables such as potatoes and corn.  What Aurelia most enjoys about her work is harvesting her land since this is when she feels that her hard work is being rewarded.  She has been in this business for years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops to the warehouses in the cities of Urubamba and Cusco.  Aurelia also raises animals such as guinea pigs, pigs and hens.

Aurelia is requesting this loan to carry out some of her plans.  She would like to increase her business raising animals such as hens and guinea pigs.  She must make her repayments on time and she is ready to do this as she would like to access future loans.  She is grateful to the institution for granting her this loan.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles to buy white hens and seed to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy white hens and seed to increase her production

loans.name: Susana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Susana de 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en su casa, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Se cacteriza por que la actividad de los pobladores es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Susana se dedica a la  crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos y gallinas), su corral que se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comidad balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos mercados de la zona donde vive.  Además cuenta con una pequeña tienda en su casa donde ofrece diferentes productos a sus clientes.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas necesita un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para  comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales y para implementar su tienda con más productos para seguir incrmentando sus ventas y así pueda más adelante realizar algunos estudios superiores.   Susana es una mujer responsable, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del lugar donde vive, por querer superarse en la vida y ayudar a sus padres económicamente.
texts.en:
Susana is 22 years old and single.  She lives with her parents in their home which is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, in Piura department.  This area is noted for the fact that its residents farm, raise livestock and make handicrafts.

Susana raises and sells poultry (turkeys and hens).  Her pen is located behind her home in order to keep her animals safe.  She feeds them balanced animal feed and natural grains.  Once they have completed their development, she sells them at the different markets in her area.  She also owns a small store in her home where she sells different products to her customers.

In order to increase her sales, Susana needs a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed for her animals and to stock her store with more products so that she can continue increasing her sales.  This will enable her, in the future, to pursue a higher education.  Susana is a responsible, hard-working and tenacious woman who is known by local residents for the fact that she wants to do well in life and help her parents financially.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and to stock her store with products

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is an individual from Ibanda. He is 38 years old and married with 6 children, 4 of whom attend school. 

Godwin has a retail shop in Nyamihima where he sells salt, sodas, soap, cosmetics, sugar and other items.  He has owned the shop for 3 years. His customers are mostly the local people in his area. In a month, he generates about 1,000,000 shillings in addition to the sale of coffee. He also sells bananas and other produce from his farms. He is very hard-working and his dream is to be able to expand his business and educate his children as well as buy more land for agriculture. He needs a loan to be able to buy more stock for the retail shop.

loans.use: To buy more salt, sodas, soap, cosmetics, sugar and other items for his shop.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es: José Guillermo, tiene la edad de 35 años, casado  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de herramientas para la construcción. El trabaja como un constructor y realiza trabajos de casas, el lo que quiere es dar a sus trabajos un acabado mas bueno y de mejores calidades. El cuenta con algunas herramientas a su poder pero para ir perfeccionando sus trabajos debe comprar unas que no posee todavía. El quiere darle a las personas que lo contratan un mejor acabado para así poder tener más ingresos económicos  con la realización de mejores trabajos. El piensa en el futuro de su hijos y su esposa, el quiere brindarles una calidad de vida mejor y seguir adelante con planes propuestos por él y su señora esposa.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Guillermo is 35 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children who are his highest priorities. He intends to use this loan to buy construction tools. José is a home builder and wants his construction jobs to be completed well and be of good quality. He has some power tools, but in order to do a perfect job he needs to acquire the ones that he does not yet own. José wants to perform the best work for the people who hire him so that he can earn more income by completing better jobs. He thinks about the future of his wife and children and wants to provide them with a better quality of life. José also wants to move forward with the plans he has made for himself and his wife.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. José has not had any previous loans with the state banks. FUDECOSUR is providing this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his construction jobs.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 50 years-old and is married with six children. She has been grateful because she is blessed with a responsible husband who really works hard for their rice farming business. Virgie is able to earn about PHP 6,000 monthly.

For the last 20 years, Virgie has grown rice. She is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 in order to provide additional capital to maintain the rice farming business. The loan will be very helpful in buying fertilizer, insecticides and a portion will be used for the payment for their helper. 

In the future, Virgie hopes to develop her rice farming business to be able to make it more productive for the second cropping.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and to pay their helper.

loans.name: Rwangoboka Kwetungura Group

texts.en:
The last 5 years have been years of unwavering hard work and determination for 32 year-old Christopher, a married father of 5 children. He operates his animal sales enterprise in Kihihi in Western Uganda. He says he began this business with savings from his farming business. He principally sells goats. From his own account, he says it’s a been a chequered experience  running this business. Some seasons, especially during public holidays and festive days, he says he does excellent business as the clientele is high. Otherwise, demand normally plummets during planting season when many people consume more of their own green vegetables and less meat.

What has made his business have an advantage during the aforementioned good seasons is the fact that he normally has lots of goats to sell. Through revenue from his side farming business, he is able to purchase more goats to add to what he already has. In this way, he can meet the heavy demands of clients.

The fact that Christopher is an optimist and a good planner is not only his winning calling card for now, but also is likely to be in the future.  He is upbeat and that helps a lot during his business's hard times. This is the third time Christopher's group is getting a loan from Pearl. Their track record in repaying their loan has been good.

Monthly, this business generates him gross sales revenue of Ugandan shillings 200,000.  He says with this Kiva loan he is going to purchase more goats to resell.  He reckons he will be able to make more sales revenue once he purchases more goats and resells them .

loans.use: to purchase more goats to resell

loans.name: Etaf

texts.en: After raising all of her kids to a point where they can take care of themselves, Etaf, a 50-year-old housewife, started to have a lot of free time for herself, which gave her the idea of starting a small home business selling make-up and accessories to the females in the area. Now Etaf is looking to bring in more types of accessories and cosmetics to her business so she can develop it and open her own store in the future.

loans.use: To buy more accessories and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Dena

texts.en:
Dena is a married man with eight children; seven attend school while one has completed school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over eighteen years, he has operated a restaurant business; his potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. He faces a major challenge of perishable products in his restaurant causing losses. Dena dreams of expanding the business to a hotel in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase food items, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase food items: bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua el  señor Cesar Agusto  se dedica día  a día  a laborar como albañil en una empresa de esta ciudad, casado con dos personas a su cargo a las que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido  a esto a decidido construir un anexo de un cuarto es por esa razón que ha tomado la decisión de iniciar la obra de mejora. es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, arena, cementó, .para iniciar la mejora de la vivienda Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Cesar Agusto works every day as a builder in a company.  He is married and has two people in his care who he has to provide for.

One of the needs that Cesar Agusto has these days is that he must improve the condition of his home.  He decided to build an extension to a room and has taken the decision to make a start on this improvement work.  For this reason, he has come to Ceprodel to request a loan so that he can buy building supplies such as metal sheets, sand and cement with which to start making the improvement to his home.  It is important to point out that, through carrying this work, he will provide his family with a decent home in which to live.

loans.use: to buy building supplies

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim  is 24, a very young and ambitious man who is already succeeding in his business. Ibrahim sells different kinds of food products in his father's shop. He continues the family business and his father is teaching him best practices. 

Ibrahim is very friendly and a polite gentlemen and this is makes his business very attractive to many customers.   His monthly income generated from his shop is 200 USD. Ibrahim would like to expand his business and for this purpose he applied for 1200 AZN.   He hopes to improve living conditions for his family. He has two daughters.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs to increase income.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 61, is a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. Single, she manages her household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.    

Anita owns a variety store. She buys groceries like canned goods, condiments, milk, sugar and primary commodities that are needed in every household. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 that will help her to continue her business well.  She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. 

Anita dreams that her sari-sari store will turn into a grocery someday. She hopes that she will have a longer life to enjoy it. She never fails to attend to the fellowship* every week as it inspires her to grow more spiritually and she can draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is from Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has two children. Anecita is engaged in an agricultural business, specializing in buying coconut to make copra and selling it to her contract buyer.  With this business, she is able to earn PHP 4000 a month. She requested a loan for PHP 6000 to buy more coconut for copra.

Anecita join GDMPC in 2010.  In the future, she hopes to purchase a vehicle for copra delivery.

loans.use: buy coconut for copra

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es: La señora Rosalía es nacida en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, vive actualmente en la zona Guaracal,  Ella se dedica a la elaboración  de pan casero y empanas, y los comercializa en su mismo domicilio y también reparte a diferentes tiendas de su zona ya que es muy conocida por la buena calidad de sus productos, se dedica a esta actividad  hace 4 años. Tiene dos hijos pequeños, La señora ya solicito créditos con la institución, demostró ser responsable en sus pagos,  Ahora el crédito otorgado a la señora es para la compra de un Horno para su negocio y  demás enseres, debido a la gran demanda que tiene y el horno que tiene ya no abastece su producción, es una joven emprendedora con deseos de superación, su deseo es el de poder tener pronto una cafetería para poder vender también ahí la variedad de productos que realiza.
texts.en: Rosalía was born in the city of Santa Cruz. At present she lives in the area of Guaracal. She makes homemade bread and empanadas and sells them from her home. She also delivers to different stores in her area since she is well known for the good quality of her products. Se has dome this activity for four years. She has two small children. She already took out loans with the institution and has shown herself to be responsible with her payments. This time the loan is to buy and oven for her business and other necessities. Due to the large demand she has, her oven can't handle her production anymore. She is an enterprising young woman who wants to get ahead. She wants to be able to open a cafeteria soon to be able to also sell a variety of products she makes.

loans.use: to have working capital (to buy an oven and other necessities)

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 35-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He opened his own barbershop in 2003. His wife works as a female hairdresser and they both cooperate together to cover the family expenses--especially their children's educationA. fees. 

Today, he's asking to borrow a loan of $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more supplies. He will also use the loan to rent a new salon in order to expand his business. He notes that these improvements will remarkably increase the family's revenues.

loans.use: To rent a new salon and purchase added supplies

loans.name: Maria Coralia

texts.es:
MARIA CORALIA.
Doña Maria Coralia de 47 años de edad, casada tiene 2 hijos, vive en San Raymundo, es dueña de una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa, además vende temprano refacciones en el mercado de su comunidad donde ella vive, desde hace ya 22 años, ella solicita un nuevo crédito para compra de productos de consumo diario, ya que empieza la época de fin de año,y en fiestas de la  época siempre aumentas sus clientes entonces ella quiere comprar esa mercadería de fin de año para poder satisfacer a su clientela que gracias a ello ella puede obtener ganancias mayores a las que obtiene ahora, entonces espera que fape pueda seguir apoyándola con este crédito ya que gracias a ellos ha podido mantener a su familia, y apoyar a sus hijos confía en que se le pueda apoyar en esta forma y agradece a fape la confianza depositada en su persona.
texts.en:
Maria Coralia is 47 years old, married with two children, and lives in San Raymundo, Guatemala.  She is the owner of a small store located in her house.  In addition, for the past 22 years, she has sold snacks early in the morning in the community market where she lives.  

She requests a new loan to buy household products.  The end-of-the-year festivities are about to begin, and her customers always increase during the parties of this period.  She wants to buy end-of-the-year merchandise to satisfy her clientele.  Thanks to them, she can make a better income compared to what she makes now.  

She hopes that FAPE can continue supporting her with these loans because, thanks to them, she has been able to provide for her family and support her children.  She trusts that FAPE can support her in this way and thanks them for the trust they have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy household products.

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha (shown in the photo), age 25, is single. She lives with her widowed mother in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Ratha is a garment worker. She is asking for her first loan of $1,200 in order to buy a motorbike to get work because she does not have her own transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to get work.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest is six. 

Amelita is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She mainly grows rice crops to sell. Amelita has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor. Amelita hopes this loan will help her have an abundant harvest. Amelita also hopes to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, a 50-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She runs a business that sells a variety of basic goods to people in the local community. Her husband works as a painter.

She requests a loan to purchase more products such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store. That will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to reinvest in her general store and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more products, such as soaps, candies, toilet paper, and shampoo to stock her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, así como también es alegre y amable, es conviviente con Robin quien es docente, vive en compañía de su suegra, cuñada, su pareja y sus hijos de 2 años y 2 meses de edad, habitando en la casa de su suegra. El negocio que Mary es la venta de comida en el frontis de la casa de su suegra, para eso cuenta con una mesa y utensilios necesarios para atender muy bien a sus clientes, ya que viendo que  su zona es transitada considera que tiene demanda y viendo la necesidad económica que tenía en su hogar se decidió por empezar en éste negocio. Espera en el futuro crecer y tener algunas personas que le ayuden. Le gusta ese negocio pues comenta le gusta mucho cocinar, pues aprendió de su madre quien le enseñó los secretos de una buena sazón, con eso espera poder ganarse la preferencia y aceptación de sus clientes. Además tiene planes de abrir un restaurante en alguna zona comercial de la ciudad de Pucallpa, logrando así obtener mayores ingresos. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Mary (27) is hardworking and earnest, with a cheerful and friendly personality.  She lives with her partner Robin who is a teacher, in his mothers house. They live together with his mother, sister, her partner and their children aged 2 years and 2 months. 

Mary has a business selling food outside the front of the house. She has a stall and the utensils needed to take good care of her customers. Mary saw that the area was busy and that there was a need for more financial support in their household, so she decided to start the business. She expects the business to grow in the future, and that she will employ people to help. 

Mary loves cooking and enjoys her work. Her mother taught her all her secrets of good flavors, and hopes that this will help her gain popularity and acceptance from her customers. Mary also has plans to open a restaurant in a commercial area of ​Pucallpa city, which would generate a higher income. 

This is Mary's first loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue the collaboration to achieve her goals. She says that she is happy with her ​​communal bank and considers its members to be good people. With the loan amount requested, Mary will for invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare food for her stall.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare food for her stall.

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Ms Huyen is 28 years old with two children who are small. She is running a construction materials shop selling products such as bathroom equipment, water pipes, etc. Her shop started five years and she earns 7,000,000 Vietnam dong per month from this business. Joining our credit program in 2010, she finds that this kind of credit is very suitable for her business.  For this new loan, she wants 8,736,000 Vietnam dong to buy more construction products to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more construction products to sell

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
Flordelina is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Flordelina has a retail shop to buy & sell canned goods, snacks, dried fish, vegetables & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, dried squid & vegetables to sell.

Flordelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Flordelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, dried squid & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Martina Emerita

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Decidió que debía aportar con sus ingresos para ayudar en los gastos del hogar.  Por este motivo emprendió en la venta de ropa entre sus familiares y amigos principalmente.  Trabaja todos los días, tanto en la mañana como en la tarde, de acuerdo a sus pedidos.  Es casada y su esposo trabaja en el Municipio.  Tiene 4 hijos, una estudia en la escuela fiscal y los otros ya son mayores de edad.  Sueña con aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su negocio.  Ahora, requiere el crédito para la compra de más ropa para su comercialización.

loans.use: Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Development I Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of Development Group, located in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone. This is a group of hard working traders who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders in order to request for a loan of SLL 3,500,000.00. They will use this loan in order to meet their most immediate financial needs – some will use it to buy a plot of land, pieces of furniture, pay school fees for their children, etc. And at the end of each month, the group leader will collect their repayment and repay SMT/Kiva on their behalf.
Baindu is the featured leader of this group. Born in Kenema, eastern Sierra Leone, she is 40 years old and has 3 children. One in primary school and two in secondary school. Baindu has been in business for 12 years now. She has requested for this loan in order to buy beans, bennie and rice to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, bennie and rice to expand her business

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a farm where he grows tomatoes, bananas and also keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
A. Rose is an active member of Life in Africa working in the Invisible Children Bracelet project. She is 34 years old, is married and has 6 children. She is Acholi and originally lived in the Pader District in Northern Uganda. It was there that the rebels attacked her village and abducted two of her children. Her children were gone for two years but were finally rescued by government troups and were returned to her in the camp she fled to in Kampala. Rose and her husband both started working in the stone quarry but they were not able to earn enough to sustain the family. When she joined LiA their lives took a turn for the better. They have more money and they have been able to save enough to build a modest home which also helps financially since they no longer have to pay rent.

Their plan now is to enlarge the stone quarry work that her husband still does. By making it their own business they will be able to hire others so her husband does not have to do all the work himself and their production will increase giving them more income. To do this she is seeking a loan in the amount of 500,000. She will be able to repay this loan in 12 months.

Below is the budget in full:-

  1. Buying stone site 200,000=

  2. Labour digging up stones 150,000=

  3. Pulling out from pit 60,000=

  4. Cracking stones 60,000=

  5. Loading onto vehicles 30,000=

    Total 500,000=

WE Team to benefit: Adult Education

loans.use: Bying and hiring people to work at the site.

loans.name: Inés

texts.en:
Inés sells kebabs of sausage and plantain, roasted beef, rice with vegetable soup, roasted chicken, buns, torillas, and sodas on the street corner next to her house. She has had this business for one year. Her husband gave her $100.00 capital to get started. Everyday she sets out her stove, some tables, and what she has prepared to sell. She sells from 4:00PM to 9:00PM. Her 15 year-old son helps her. She worked from the time she was young cleaning houses. She quit doing this because her children had to stay at home alone, and she was worried about the gangs in the area. Thanks to her work, and that of her husband, they have been able to own their house and the business.

She needs the loan to make a wooden kiosk that she can locate outside of the house, and for tables and plastic chairs.

Inés was born in Esmeralda. She is 42 years old and has four children. Her husband works as a security guard. Inés is a very hardworking and persevering person who has always worked for her family and has always been an important source of support in their home. Inés and her husband hope to get ahead with their jobs and continue prospering, especially in the business and in the education of their children.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Inés vende: chuzos. Carne azada, arroz con menestra, pollo asado, bollos, tortillas y gaseosas en la esquina de su casa. Tiene 1 año de experiencia en esta actividad. Su esposo le dio el capital para arrancar $ 100. Todos los días saca su fogón, mesas y lo que ha preparado para vender. Ella vende de 4:00PM a 9:00PM. Su hijo de 15 años le ayuda. Ella trabajo desde pequeña arreglando casas. Ella dejo de hacerlo porque sus hijos quedaban solos en casa, y por los grupos de pandilla que existían. Gracias a su trabajo y el de su esposo han podido tener su casa y el negocio.

Ella necesita el préstamo para hacer un kiosco de madera y ubicarlo a fuera de su casa y mesas y sillas plásticas.

Inés nació en Esmeralda, tiene 42 años. Con 4 hijos. Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Siendo un soporte importante en su hogar. Inés es una persona muy trabajadora, perseverante que siempre ha trabajado por su familia. Ellos desean seguir adelante con sus trabajos y seguir prosperando especialmente en el negocio y en la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: To make a wooden kiosk and buy tables and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large marking centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. MAbraham K. is a resident of Nkurankan and sells cooking ingredients. She is also a client of Kraban Support Foundation and is however seeking a Kiva loan of $700.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: Wants to expand business of cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Lala

texts.en: Lala is a mother of one child. She is 47, lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. She has raised cattle. Lala started this business 8 years ago. Now she requests a loan of $475 to buy a cow for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro V. is 30 years old and has been married to Maria Sosa for a year. The couple have an 8 month old son who is their pride and joy.

Alejandro has been working since he was very young to support himself and pay for his high school education because his parents could not afford to. He held many jobs and upon graduating high school, he traveled to the capital city of Asuncion to learn a trade that would allow him to start his own business. He enrolled in beauty school and studied to become a hair stylist. After two years of school he graduated and worked as an assistant stylist and barber for several years.

With some savings he was able to put together, he returned to his hometown and opened his own hair salon seven years ago. Today, because of his hard work and talent, he has many clients.

Alejandro is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase an electric hair trimmer and a hair dryer because the current machines are old and he'd like to modernize his salon.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Alejandro V. tiene 30 años se casó hace un año con la María Sosa y tienen un hijo varón de apenas 8 meses que es la adoración de la pareja.

Alejandro trabajó desde muy joven para poder ganarse su sustento y pagar sus estudios secundarios, ya que sus padres no podían hacerlo. Realizó diferentes tipos de trabajos, y cuando culminó sus estudios secundarios viajo a la ciudad de Asunción (capital del país) para estudiar un oficio con el que pueda trabajar y generar sus propio negocio. Fue así como se inscribió en una institución para estudiar peluquería, luego de dos años se recibió de profesional y trabajo en una peluquería como ayudante durante unos varios años.

Con unos ahorros que logró juntar, Alejandro, volvió a su ciudad natal y monto su propia peluquería, que funciona ya hace más de siete años. Gracias a su buen trabajo y esfuerzo ha ganado mucha clientela.

Hoy día Alejandro solicita un crédito de $ 200 para poder comprar una máquina de cortar eléctrica y un secador de cabello, pues las máquinas que tiene actualmente ya están viejas y desea modernizar su peluquería.

loans.use: To purchase an electric hair trimmer and hair dryer

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Hi. My name is Regina and I'm a business owner. I rely on my income from a small pastry and sweets business located in the center of the city where I live. I have several years experience doing this and it allows me to earn income so that I can contribute to family expenses. I don't have enough credit now to [buy the goods that I need] to meet existing [customer] demand so I'm asking for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Regina, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de reposteria y venta de Golosinas, ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me permite generar ingresos para colaborar con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente no cuento con el capital suficiente para satisfacer la demanda existente por lo que solicito el apoyo de ustedes.

loans.use: Buy flour, eggs, margarine, sugar, soft drinks and instant soups for resell.

loans.name: Iyobo

texts.en: Iyobo O. is 38 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She has been in business since 2004. She seeks a loan of $550 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther N. sells clothing. She wants the loan to increase her inventory of clothes.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Rosana's Group

texts.es:
The group was formed thanks to Mrs. Rosana S. that knew about the program “Committee of Enterprising Women” developed by the Paraguayan Foundation through a friend. She hence gathered a group of friends and neighbors to form her committee.

Although this is a new group, you can see the dedication and sense of responsibility each of these members has in their respective businesses. They perform different types of endeavors. Amongst them are sellers of fruit salads, sodas, fruits, and vegetables; others sell prepared foods; some sell clothing; and some sell ice creams and sweets. Daily they go out into their neighborhood offering their products in addition to taking care of their families.

They are asking for the loan to purchase merchandise to sell and in other cases to buy necessary ingredients to prepare their products. They are anxious to keep on growing and increase their incomes and profits so they can improve their quality of life a little bit at a time.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo se formo gracias a la Sra. Rosana S. que tubo conocimiento del programa “Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras” que desarrolla la Fundación Paraguaya a través de una amiga. Fue así que ella reunió a un grupo de amigas y vecinas para formar su comité.

Este es un grupo nuevo, pero aún así podemos ver la dedicación y responsabilidad que posee cada integrante en sus negocios. Ellas realizan distintos tipos de actividades, entre ellas hay algunas que venden ensaladas de frutas, gaseosas, frutas y verduras, otras venden comidas rápidas, otras venden ropas, otras helados y golosinas. Ellas diariamente salen a las calles a recorrer ofreciendo sus productos y además de ello cuidan de sus familias.

Solicitan el crédito para invertirlos en la compra de mercaderías para la venta y en otros casos para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de sus productos. Ellas están muy ansiosas por seguir creciendo y ampliar sus ingresos y ganancias de tal modo a mejorar cada vez más su calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy fruits, sweets, sodas, meats, cheese, milk, flour, sugar, vegeables, ice creams, etc.

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en:
Aslan has been selling dried fruits and nuts for over four years. When his father died, he became the main bread-winner for his large family. Aslan has worked hard and, as a result, his business has become successful and provides a stable income.

He will use this loan to purchase dried fruits and nuts for resale and also to repair the car he uses to transport goods.

Aslan is 30 years old, married with three children, and also supports his mother and younger brothers. He thanks everyone for their trust and promises to repay his loan accurately.

loans.use: Purchase dried fruits and nuts and repair a vehicle

loans.name: Abdullaeva

texts.ru:
T. Abdullaeva is a mother of 3 who sells traditional pastries and sweets. Her husband works as a tractor driver at a farm, but instead of getting a salary he is paid in food items. Besides these activities, she and her husband raise livestock to sell. Right now they have 1 cow and 3 rams. T. would like to have more animals and this is what her loan from MicroInvest would be used for.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Абдуллаева Тохира мать 3 детей ,занимается бизнесом национальных сладостей .Муж работает в колхозе трактористом, хотя ему вместо зарплаты дают продукты питания.Но помимо своей работы он со своей женой занимаются откормом скота.На данный момент они имеют одну корову си 3 барана.Тохира хочет увеличить колличество скота , для чего за кредитом обратилась в Микроинвест.

loans.use: Buy more livestock

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe F. is married and has three daughters who are 10, 15, and 19 years old, respectively. Her husband works as a driver. After her husband had an accident while driving a truck at work she started her own business which allows her to help support her family and buy medicines for her husband. Since her husband did not have insurance, she had to start her own business at home in order to obtain money to cover family expenses, buy medicines for her husband, and also to help take care or her children. She started in July 1997 by selling catalog shoes to her neighbors and family. Currently two of her daughters help her with the collection of outstanding debt.

Guadalupe is requesting a $500 loan which she will repay in 6 months. With this money she will buy more merchandise and she will be able to offer more products to her clients. With your help Guadalupe will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Guadalupe F. es casada y tiene 3 hijas 3 de 10 años; 15 años y 19 años, su esposo trabaja como chofer. Inició el negocio ante la necesidad de tener un ingreso para poder comer y comprar medicinas para su esposo el cual sufrió un accidente cuando manejaba un camión de su trabajo, debido a que no tenia seguro medico, tuvo que iniciar su propio negocio en su casa, para tener dinero para el gasto familiar y poder comprar medicinas para su esposo, atenderlo y cuidarlo así como a sus menores hijos. Comenzó en julio de 1997 vendiendo calzado por catalogo con sus vecinos y familiares cercanos. Actualmente 2 de sus hijas le ayudan en la cobranza a los clientes.

Solicita un crédito por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar más mercancía y poder surtir productos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Guadalupe saldrá adelante

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Akou A. was born in 1978 in Ghana. The mother of five children, she is married to a farmer and presently resides in Afoudomé (in Zio County). At a young age she began a small grocery business. Very serious and hard-working, she is a natural businesswoman and has shown herself to be a woman who can be trusted. In order to expand her business and make it more profitable, she is requesting a loan to use to stock up on foodstuffs in large quantities so that she can better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Akou est née en 1978 au Ghana. Mère de cinq (5) enfants elle est mariée à un cultivateur et vit à présent à Afoudomé (P/Zio). Elle s’est lancée très tôt dans le petit commerce d’alimentation générale. Très sérieuse et appliquée, elle a le don des affaires et fait preuve d’une femme de confiance. Pour renforcer son activité et la rentabiliser plus, elle sollicite un financement qui lui servira à s’approvisionner en grande quantité des produits alimentaires afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Stocking up on foodstuffs

Aprovisionnement en produits alimentaires

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mr. Touch T., 55, is a motorcycle taxi driver, earning approximately $5.80 per day. His wife, Mrs. Mao Rat, is a farmer. They have six children, two of whom are married. The family lives in Toul Sangke village, Kampong Thom Province.

T. is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a bull to provide stud services to other cattle businesses. The loan will allow him to start a new business to supplement his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a bull to provide stud services to other cattle businesses

loans.name: Sothorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sothorn P. is a driver in Trear Chaoeng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Phoeurn Loung, is a farmer. A severe dry spell of late has meant that her crops have done theri worst this season.

In order to solve this problem, Mr. Sothorn P. is requesting a loan to buy a pump to water the field. Mr. Sothorn P. has a child who is employed in a garment factory. Previously, Mr. Sothorn P. had obtained a loan to add to his savings to build a new house and he fully repaid the loan. His wife is shown in the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate their crops.

loans.name: Denise
