texts.fr:
Agée de 41 ans, Mme O. Denise est mariée et mère de quatre enfants .Ayant adopté la polygamie comme régime matrimonial, son mari se trouve incapable de s’occuper convenablement de sa famille nombreuse. O. se lança donc dans le commerce de bouillie de maïs et de jus de fruits ; activité qu’elle exerce depuis 15 ans et qui est très rentable. 
      
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, elle sollicite un crédit pour l’achat de vélos et recrutement d’agents pour le commerce ambulant de jus en plus de stockage de céréales pour la préparation de bouillie. Cela lui permettra de joindre les deux bouts.
texts.en:
At the age of 41, Madame Denise O. is married and the mother of four children. Her husband, having adopted a polygamous approach to marriage, is unable to properly care for his large family. Therefore, Mrs. O. went into the business of preparing and selling porridge and fruit juice; this has been her occupation for fifteen years, and it is highly profitable. To meet the demands of her consistently growing clientele, she is requesting a loan to purchase bicycles and to hire sales representatives in order to mobilize her business. The remainder of the loan will go to increasing her stock of grain. This will allow her to make ends meet.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of grains for preparation of porridge and purchase bicycles

loans.name: Sadith Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Sadith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas” ubicado en Jr. Serafín Filomeno Nº 248, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 67 años de edad, es madre de 3 nietos menores de edad que aún dependen de ella, es soltera y apoya a su hijo mayor que trabaja en el planchando de autos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/.300, decide invertir en la venta de golosinas.

En la actualidad cuenta con varios negocios, entre ellos tenemos la venta de gaseosas, de hamburguesas, de raspadilla, por las noches vende salchipapas, también brinda el servicio de lavado de ropa ajena, etc. Es una mujer trabajadora e independiente.

Con este préstamo de S/.1.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de un trompo de construcción civil para trabajar con la ayuda de su hijo.
   
Sadith se siente una mujer con mucha fuerza para seguir adelante, agradece de corazón a Manuela Ramos por apoyar a la mujer ucayalina.
texts.en:
Sadith belongs to “Las Brisas” community bank located at No.248 Jr. Serafin Filomeno, district of Calleria, Ucayali. She is 67 years old, has three young grandchildren that depend on her, she is single and helps her older son who works as a car detailer. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos of $100 US (S/.300), she decided to invest in selling food. Currently, she works on different activities, such as selling sodas, burgers, slushy drinks, at night she sells hot dogs with French fries, she also provides laundry services. She is a hardworking and independent woman. With this loan of $500 US (S/.1500), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy construction equipment to work with the help of her son. Sadith feels strong to keep going ahead, she thanks Manuela Ramos from the bottom of her heart for helping the Ucayalin woman.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction equipment

loans.name: Ipagala D Group

texts.en:
Halima has been keeping livestock in Dodoma, Tanzania, for 12 years. She works for 9 hours every day and is able to earn approximately $100 each month. This is Halima's first access to a loan and she is looking forward to purchasing medicine, food and shelter for her livestock once she receives it. She hopes that by improving the conditions for her chickens, she will be able to increase her profits. She intends to use the profit to buy more food for her family and to continue to expand her business.

Halima is 48 years old and widowed. She has four children between the ages of 21 and 30 and she also cares for three additional dependants. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Jane, Grace, Magreth and Furugelia.

loans.use: To buy medicine, food and shelter for her livestock.

loans.name: Fondoumi

texts.fr: Fondoumi F. est revendeuse de céréales au grand marché d’Atakpame depuis 5 ans. Agée de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle désire avec ce crédit relancer son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, de mil, de haricots et d'arachides pour la commercialisation. Fondoumi habite à Atakpame, une ville située dans la région centrale du Togo.
texts.en:
Fondoumi F. has been reselling cereals in the grand market in Atakpame for five years. She's 49 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. With this loan, she wishes to reinvigorate her business by buying sacks of corn, millet, beans, and peanuts, in order to resell them. Fondoumi lives in Atakpame, a city located in the Central Region in Togo.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell sacks of corn, millet, beans and peanuts

loans.name: R.c. Boys School Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the RC Boys School in Magburaka. R.C Boys is a primary school. It was founded in 1955 by the Catholic missionaries. Today, it has a total of 250 pupils with a staff of twelve teachers and administrators. This school is proud that they almost always earn a 98-100% pass rate on the National Primary School Exams (NPSE).

RC Boys had never got a loan from SMT before.  They heard of SMT from colleagues in other schools who have benefited greatly from SMT’s services. They decided to form a group and send in an application to SMT requesting a loan after hearing these other success stories. With the loan, some of the staff members will start a small business and those who are already run small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will be using the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children's education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home building projects.  

Government salaries are usually quite small for teachers, thus making teaching an unattractive profession for many whose primary motivator is money. Many choose other jobs over teaching because of the small salary, thus starving the field of qualified personnel to teach the children. The few who remain in the classroom have to find other ways of making ends meet. The vast majority of them engage in either business or agriculture or they provide extra tutorial classes for the children (although this is a practice the government is trying to stop). Needless to say, loans from SMT are a great help to the teachers in order to boost their businesses or invest it in something productive. Many want to go to school but could not afford the cost. Some will want to buy pieces of furniture, but their monthly salary is not enough to let them do so. With a loan, they will be able to meet some of these needs.  And with their monthly salaries, they can repay easily via a payroll deduction type of system.

Fifty-nine year old Augustine J. Kalokoh (back row, fourth from left) is the head teacher at the school.  He was born in Makali, only a few miles from Magburaka town. He is married with five children. One is in class three, one in junior secondary school III (JSS III) and three are in senior secondary school III (SSS III). Augustine will use his loan to purchase house building materials, specifically cement for bricks. In Magburaka town, where he will do this purchase, a bag of cement will cost him Le 36,000. Augustine will use the loan to buy as many bags of cements as the loan can offer.

loans.use: Purchasing house building materials

loans.name: Mencia

texts.es: Mencia tiene 43 años, es casada y vive con sus 4 hijos. Ella es una personas muy trabajadora y esforzada en sus labores, tanto como agricultora y como ganadera, actividades que desde hace 20 años viene realizando junto a toda su familia, quienes contribuyen en el desarrollo económico de su hogar. Pero es Mencia quien  tiene la sobrecargada labor como madre, esposa y ganadera, para lo cual tiene que distribuir su tiempo sin perjudicar ninguna de sus  labores, siendo una muy buena madre, esposa y agricultora, su ganado, cada día, van en aumento y la raza de sus animales muy bien valorada en los mercados, y venderlos le alcanza para dos meses de alimento en su hogar. Mencia está muy comprometida con el nuevo banco comunal que formó en MFP, además, su nivel de responsabilidad es muy reconocido. Con el dinero solicitado tiene pensado comprar una vaca que incremente su producción de leche y quesos, para tener con esto, un ingreso adicional para su familia.
texts.en:
Mencia is 43 years old. She is married and lives with her 4 children. She is a very hard worker and exerts herself as a farmer as well as a cattle-raiser. She has been doing these activities for 20 years with her whole family. They contribute to the economic development of her home, but Mencia is the one overloaded with jobs as mother, wife and cattle-raiser, which means she has to distribute her time without jeapardizing any of her jobs. She is a very good mother, wife, farmer and cattle-raiser. Each day her livestock increases and her animals are highly valued at the markets. Selling them gives her enough for two months worth of food for her home. Mencia is very committed to the new community bank started at MFP (Microfinanzas Prisma), besides, her sense of responsibility is well known. With the money she has requested, she intends to buy a cow to increase her milk and cheese production to have additional income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cow to increase her production

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta and her husband Cesar are both farmers.  Later on, Violeta decided to engage in the vending business that sells root crops coming from their own harvest.  She and her husband are blessed with five children, however, due to lack of financial resources, they were not able to send most of their children to school to pursue their studies.  Their children are: Cherry Rose – 27 years old, high school graduate; Charita – 20 years old, elementary graduate; Debot – 18 years old, elementary graduate; Krisel – 17 years old, high school graduate and John, the youngest is 8 years old, an elementary student studying in a public school.  

Violeta is requesting for a loan of PHP9, 000.00 which she will use to purchase farm inputs like seed variety and fertilizer.  She will also use some of the loan to maintain her vegetable vending and root crops planting business where she gets most of her vegetable products.  She is hoping that someday, she can develop their farming and vending business for them to meet the needs of their family.  She and her husband are helping one another in the farm.  She hopes that their continuous earnings will continue to sustain their business.  Violeta prays that their children will all have a better life compared to what they have at the moment.

loans.use: purchase farm inputs and to maintain her vegetable business

loans.name: Margarita Concepcion

texts.es:
Margarita inició el negocio porque quería sentirse una persona útil y ademas le gustan mucho las ventas y como sus hijos ya están grandes y pueden valerse solos  le quedaba más tiempo libre. 
Comenzó el negocio en Febrero de 2006  en el patio de su casa vendiendo la ropa que dejában de usar, después una de sus vecinas la animó para que comprara pacas de ropa usada las cuales salen muy baratas y se venden rápido y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.  

Poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus ventas y en la actualidad ya cuenta con un buen número de clientes que compran la ropa usada que trai de Estados Unidos.
Ella necesita un prestamo por MXN $7000 que pagara en 10 catorcenas .
Con este crédito va a poder comprar pacas de ropa usada para la temporada de primavera y verano que esta próxima y así tener un buen surtido para su clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita started the business because she wanted to feel useful and because she likes sales. Her children are grown now and can take care of themselves so she has plenty of free time. She started the business in February 2006, on the patio of her house, selling used clothes. Later, a neighbor gave her the idea to buy bundles of used clothes which were selling very cheaply and quickly turn them around. Things have been going well ever since. Margarita's sales have increased bit by bit and she can now count on a good number of customers who buy used clothes brought from the United States. She needs a MXN$7,000 loan that she will pay in 10 14-day installments. She will use the money to buy bundles of used clothes appropriate for the coming spring and summer seasons so that she has a good supply for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha A. is a "sari-sari" store owner.  She is 35 years old and has 4 children.  Aside from her store, she is raising chickens in their backyard.  She and her husband are working their best to send their children to school.  Juditha dreamed of having a small eatery someday.

She has been a CEVI client for 4 years.

Juditha is asking for a loan of 14,000PHP from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stock to attract customers. She believes that her loan will bring her good income.  In this way, she will have more to give her children to pay their tuition, books and other school projects.

CEVI is helping her sustain her store.  Juditha receives credit, trainings and insurance coverage to help her business grow.

loans.use: Buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana A. M. is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Her husband works in a hotel as a clerk. Currently, the kids are in school. She has been sewing for eleven years now. She is a specialist in female wear. Her skills and designs are first class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, like kid's school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work, Joana has two apprentices whom she is giving quality training for their future dependency. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with a quality education. She belongs to the village bank called Truth. She hopes to receive GH¢1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Ni Komang Sri Virgawati

texts.en:
Ni Komang Sri Virgawati is a 25-year-old female living in the town of Dsn. PangkugLiplip, Ds, Kaliakah. She is married and has an infant child. To making a living, Ni Komang Sri Virgawati owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling religious items. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling incense and candles to tourists and local community members. Ni Komang Sri Virgawati has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Komang Sri Virgawati joined Kiva's partner DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Komang Sri Virgawati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

Ni Komang Sri Virgawati is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase materials to make prayer/worship materials. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI.  Ni Komang Sri Virgawati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to financially support immediate members of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small-business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Komang Sri Virgawati - (DNR.M-0638) merupakan 25 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Dsn. PangkugLiplip, Ds, Kaliakah.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 1 anak usia balita.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Komang Sri Virgawati memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor ritel.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah menjual pernak-pernik keagamaan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual dupa & lilin kepada wisatawan dan anggota masyarakat setempat.  Ni Komang Sri Virgawati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang Sri Virgawati menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Komang Sri Virgawati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Komang Sri Virgawati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk memperbaiki kendaraan pengangkut yang digunakan di dalam bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 500,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bahan untuk membuat bahan sembahyang/ibadah.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Komang Sri Virgawati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase materials to make prayer/worship materials

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan T., pictured here with her husband, is thirty-four years old. They have three children and reside in Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, making around $10 in revenue per day, while her husband is a police officer who makes $3 every day. Two of their children are in school and one operates a coffee shop. To bring more money into the family, Mrs. Chan T. would like to take out a loan to reinvest in her son’s coffee shop.

loans.use: To reinvest in her son’s coffee shop.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita M. is from the village of Makawa, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Anecita is married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Anecita owns and operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from the making and selling of nipa huts (an indigenous house constructed out of bamboo tied together, with a thatched roof using nipa/anahaw leaves) and mats. Anecita has been engaged in her business for more than 19 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Anecita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anecita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Anecita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used additional capital for the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Anecita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 57 años, es una mujer muy optimista y preocupada por el progreso de su familia, la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos. Desde muy joven estuvo involucrada en el comercio de productos de segunda mano, pero al casarse, junto a su esposo tuvieron la idea de comprar un auto; entonces, ambos juntaron sus ahorros y adquirieron uno de segunda mano, con el que ahora trabajan brindado el servicio de transporte de carga interprovincial y justamente en este momento su movilidad se encuentra en otra ciudad. En este negocio Martha se encarga de la administración de las ganancias y de mantener en buen estado el auto, procurando su revisión mecánica periódicamente. Su deseo a futuro es adquirir otros autos para tener una flota de transporte de carga, ya que este negocio le está resultando muy rentable y de gran demanda. Este es su 9no crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, la permanencia en su banco comunal le ha permitido desarrollar habilidades que desconocía en ella, las cuales han aflorado con el apoyo de todas sus compañeras, quienes trabajan organizadamente y con suma responsabilidad. Los 2000 soles que ahora solicita son muy importantes para su negocio, ya que tendrá la posibilidad de completar el monto para adquirir un auto adicional e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Martha is 57 years old. She is a very optimistic woman and worried about the progress of her family, which is comprised of her husband and their 3 children. Since she was very young she has been involved in the business of second hand products. When she married, she and her husband had the idea to buy a car, so both joined their savings and acquired a second hand one, which they now work with offering a transport service for interstate cargo. Precisely at this moment their mobility is in another city. In this business Martha is charged with the administration of the profits and maintaining the car in a good state, trying to do mechanical inspections periodically. Her wish for the future is to acquire other cars to have a cargo transport fleet, now that this business is resulting in being profitable and in great demand. This is her 9th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. The continuance of her communal bank has permitted her to develop skills she was unaware of, which have blossomed with the support of her colleagues, who work in an organised way and with responsibility. The 2000 soles that she is requesting now are very important for her business, as she will now have the possibility to finish the total amount to acquire an additional car and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the amount neccesary to buy a car

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh D., 28, is a married father of one son. His family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district on rental land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son, Yusuntumur, is 2 and taken care of by Altansuh's mother-in-law. 

In 2004, Altansuh started running a retail business selling a variety of small items depending on the season. For instance, he sells balls and other outdoor toys in the summer. In the autumn, he sells books and school suits, while in the winter he sells socks, gloves, Christmas trees, etc.

Altansuh goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, once or twice a month to purchase goods for his business. Since last summer, Altansuh's wife, Otgon, who is 27, has been helping her husband's business. With the profit, Altansuh has already started saving small amounts to have his own place to live. "By 2010, I’m aiming to purchase a plot of land and a small house unless land prices increase," he said. With this loan, he will purchase outdoor toys such as basketballs and kites to increase his business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase basketballs and kites

loans.name: Jorge Alejandro

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Jorge Alejandro M. le está haciendo falta la barda ala rededor. 
Pero con su sueldo es muy bajo no puede compara el material y pagarle a la persona que se dedicara a elaborar la barda. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para que su casa esté segura cuando su el y su esposa estén trabajado, ya les han robados en varios ocasiones. 
Don Jorge trabaja de despachador de una gasolinera en la ciudad y su esposa la señora María Teresa Mora  trabaja limpiando casa. Estos son los ingresos que tiene para salir adelante y con el cual pagaran el crédito.
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora María Teresa quien nos atendió ya que el señor Jorge se encontraba trabajando.
texts.en:
Sr. Jorge Alejandro M. is missing a security wall around his house. However, he does not earn enough money to pay for the materials and labor required to put up the wall. This is why he is requesting a loan to make his home safer while he and his wife are at work. They have been burglarized on several occasions.

Don Jorge works as a dispatcher for a gas station in the city. His wife, Sra. Maria Teresa Mora, cleans houses. Their incomes help them get ahead and will be used to repay this loan.

The woman in the photo is Sra. Maria Teresa, since Don Jorge was working at the time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall around his house

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina T. is a 50-year-old woman who is determined to improve the way her family lives. She is married to a farmer, Mr. Domingo T., and blessed with 11 children. The Tilanes family resides in Brgy. Batuan, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. 

Ma. Cristina T. admits that it is very hard to raise 11 children, especially when the family income cannot support the needs of the family. But determination, and being armed with her knowledge of handling a business, has helped her to survive the difficulties.

Mrs. Cristina T. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 and used her first loan of Php 3,000 to open a "sari-sari" or general store. She slowly expanded her business with each loan until she was able to add new lines to her business like selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes. Her general or "sari-sari" store now earns her a monthly income of Php 6,000. The income she earned in her business has enabled her to make a down-payment on a motorcycle for her husband which will also be used in her business.

At present Mrs. T. is on her 10th loan and is borrowing Php 17,000 which she intends to invest in expanding her business.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: there make larger there business

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina F. grows rice. She is 59 years old and a widow, and has been a CEVI client for quite a long time now. She has workers at her farm. She pays them for their labor so they can support their individual families. She says that her rice field is such a big help because it supplies her with all her needs like food, clothing and medicines, as well as money to pay for the daily expenses in her home.

She would like to ask a loan of PHP 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to finance her farming activities, like paying the laborers and buying seeds and other farming needs. 

The loan will help Felina immensely to grow her business. With her loan, she will be able to sustain her livelihood and earn more income in the future.

loans.use: To finance farming activities

loans.name: Dado Denise

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier d’Attiégou à Lomé ; elle est très expérimentée dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale, puisque c’est en 1994 qu’elle s’est lancée dans ce commerce. Elle a un sens aigu de la gestion ce qui fait qu’actuellement elle a agrandi sa boutique ; en effet, elle vend en ce moment des produits pharmaceutiques communément appelés « produits génériques » qui lui rapportent bien. Elle compte même dans l’avenir vendre aussi des pagnes ; et ouvrir une autre boutique dans un autre quartier qu’elle choisira. Elle a un besoin pressant de renouveler certains de ses produits manquants ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 cartons de lait Pick, 05 cartons de pâte alimentaire, 03 cartons de tomates, 12 boîtes de paracétamol, des fortifiants et bien d’autres produits. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the neighborhood of Attiégou in Lomé. She is very well experienced in the sale of general foodstuffs; she launched this business in 1994. She has a keen sense of management, which mean that she is currently enlarging her shop. In fact, at the moment she is currently selling pharmaceutical products, "generic products" which earn good revenues for her. In the future she intends to also sell "pagnes" (colorful wax cloth) and to open another boutique in a different neighborhood of her choosing. She has an urgent need to renew her stock of certain products - it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution WAGES. She will use the loan to purchase 5 cartons of Pick brand milk, 5 cartons of pasta, 3 cartons of tomatoes, 12 boxes of paracetamol and several other products. She is married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products and generic medicines

loans.name: Dalila Eufemia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Damas de Mente Positiva está ubicado en la  urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, la ciudad se caracteriza por sus iglesias coloniales, la belleza que  la ciudad encierra,  siendo considerada Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad  y por todos los lugares turísticos que ofrece al turista nacional y extranjero.

El banco comunal está conformado por un grupo de socias alegres, unidas y colaboradoras entre sí,  que llevan varios años trabajando con  la fundación.

La  señora  Dalila Eufemia  Muñoz Q. es oriunda del cantón Milagro provincia del Guayas, llegó hace doce años a la ciudad de Cuenca y vive en el barrio El  Batan, un lugar lleno de tradición e historia Cuencana.

Dalila tiene 56 años de edad, se encuentra casada y procreó cuatro  hijos de 38, 36, 35, 26 años de edad, sus tres hijas se encuentran casadas y viven en el cantón Milagro, ella vive con su hijo de 35 años y su esposo que ya es jubilado por lo que su hijo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, no tienen casa propia viven arrendando.

Dalila trabaja como vendedora ambulante de  ropa, lleva ocho años ejerciendo esta actividad  recorriendo todos los pueblos y parroquias de la ciudad y cada 15 días viaja a la costa al Ingenio San Carlos para vender su mercadería a los empleados que allí laboran y para traer nueva mercadería de la ciudad de Guayaquil.

Dalila y las socias de su banco comunal  se llevan muy bien entre sí, manteniendo un buen núcleo de amistad,  trabaja con  los prestamos de la fundación hace cinco  años y nos cuenta que le han beneficiado mucho en su  negocio porque le han permitido  incrementar su capital de trabajo  y así poder traer más mercadería, con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le  entregue  lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa surtida para damas, caballeros y niños  para mantener con un stock adecuado para la época navideña.

Su meta es seguir creciendo con su negocio y ponerse un local tipo boutique.
texts.en:
The community bank "Damas de Mente Positiva" is located in the urban region of Cuenca. This city is famous for its colonial churches, for the beauty encapsulated by the city, and is known in the national and international turist community as a centre of culture for humanity.

The community bank is made up of a group of happy, collegial and hardworking women who have been with the foundation for many years.

Dalila Eufemia Munoz Q. is originally from Milagro in the Guayas province. She came to Cuenca twelve yars ago and she currently lives in the El Batan district, a region that is full of the traditions and history of Cuenca.

Dalila is 56 years old, she is married, and she has four children, aged 38, 36, 36, and 26. Her three daughters are married and live in Milagro. She lives with her 35-year old son and her now-retired husband. Her son helps out with the household expenses, especially because they do not own a house, they rent the house they live in.

Dalila works as a travelling sales person, selling clothing. She has been running this business for the past eight years, walking through all the districts and parishes in the city. Every second week she goes to the coastal region of Ingenio San Carlos to sell her merchandise to the workers there, and to purchase new merchandise from the city of Guaqyaquil.

Dalila and the other members of the community bank work very wll together, always maintaining a strong foundation of friendship amoung them. She has been working with loans from the foundation for the past five years and she says that it has largely helped her business. She uses the loans as working capital to purchase more merchandise. With the loan from Fundacion Espoir (Kiva Field Partner) she will invest in the purchase of a variety of clothing for ladies, gentlement and for kids, so that she will have a large enough selection for the Christmas season.

Her goal is to keep her business growing and to set up a boutique-style shop.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of clothing for ladies, gentlement and kids for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda R. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 61 years old. Erlinda is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es el ejemplo latente de mujer peruana que desea salir adelante, ella tiene 39 años y vive en compañía de su esposo Luis, de 40 años, que trabaja como obrero en la construcción de carreteras; y con sus dos hijos: Judith de 13 y Luis de 8 años.

Ella tiene en una pequeña peluquería que adaptó en la sala de su casa, empieza su labor desde muy temprano, pasa el día entero cortando el cabello de las personas, creando los más modernos peinados para los exigentes clientes que parecen quedar muy satisfechos, luego de pasar por sus manos.
Alicia empezó este negocio hace 14 años, cuando puso en práctica sus conocimientos de cosmetología que aprendió de joven, y así ha logrado apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, además como el espacio de la peluquería es amplio decidió empezar a vender también diversos productos de belleza, los cuales ofrece a sus entusiastas clientes que buscan siempre mejorar su aspecto. 
Alicia vive en su mundo de estilo y belleza, siempre con la mente positiva de querer salir adelante porque en el futuro quiere tener un gran salón de belleza, y quizás en unos años más llegar tener un salón en otro lugar de la zona donde vive, porque ella piensa en expandirse y crecer económicamente. 

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que será responsable con cada pago, además está muy contenta con el trabajo de su grupo porque está compuesto por mujeres emprendedoras como ella.Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará diversos tipos de adornos y juguetes para venderlos en un espacio de su peluquería, porque en el futuro también quisiera tener un bazar, ya que ella piensa en progresar para poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alicia is the indicative example of a Peruvian woman who wants move forward. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband Luis (40 years old) who works as a highway construction worker; and with her two children: Judith (13 years old) and Luis (8 years old).

She has a small hair salon set up in her home’s living room. She starts her work very early, spending the whole day cutting people’s hair, creating the most modern hairstyles for the discerning clients who seem to be very satisfied with her work.

Alicia started this business 14 years ago, when she put into practice the knowledge of cosmetology that she learned as a young woman. With this business, she has been able to support her husband with the household expenses. In addition, since the salon is spacious, she decided to start selling various beauty products which she offers to her enthusiastic clients who are always trying to improve their appearance. Alicia lives in her world of style and beauty, always with a positive mind that wants to push forward because in the future, she wants to have a large beauty salon. Maybe, in a few mO. years, she will have a salon in another part of the area where she lives because she is thinking about expanding and growing economically.

This is the second loan she has had with MFP and she guarantees that she will be responsible for each payment; in addition, she is very pleased with the group’s work because it is made up of enterprising women like her. With the funds she is now requesting, she will buy various types of decorations and toys to sell in her salon, because in the future, she would also like to have a bazaar. Now she thinks about making progress so she can give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase merchandise

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en: Genevieve is 30 years old and owns a rice farm. She manages this farm very carefully because it is the source of her income. She needs to buy equipment, and has turned to CEVI, a microfinance institution in the Philippines, for a loan of PHP 9,000. Genevieve will will use this loan to upgrade her farm, produce an abundant harvest, and increase her income.

loans.use: to upgrade her farm

loans.name: Lourdes Suyapa

texts.es:
la señora Lourdes Suyapa B. V. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Benigno Zamora, tienen 4 hijos, dos dependen de ellos, su compañero de hogar trabaja en finca santa rosa. Lourdes se dedica a vender lacteos,golosinas y refrescos. tiene un año de vender este tipo de productos, las ventas de las golosinas y los refrescos son los fines de semana y los demas
dias son para la venta de lacteos. esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas lacteos ya que la demanda de sus clientes es grande y no cubre con todos los pedidos que tiene en la semana.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lourdes Suyapa is 38 years old and lives in a common law union with Mr. Benigno Zamora. They have 4 children, 2 of whom still depend on them. Her companion works on Santa Rosa farm.

For the last year Lourdes has been selling milk products, sweets, and soft drinks. On weekends she sells the sweets and soft drinks, and on weekdays she sells the milk products.

Lourdes is soliciting a loan to buy more milk products, since customer demand is great and she can't cover all the orders she gets during the week.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CHEESE, BUTTER, AND SOFT CHEESE TO SELL

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es: La Señora Delia Maria tiene la edad de 48 años. Tiene 3 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es la venta leña, frijoles cocidos cuajadas. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Por lo que tenía que buscar una fuente para sobrevivir, y debido a los pocos conocimientos de estudio que recibió, no pudo obtener un mejor trabajo. Delia es una mujer muy humilde, por lo que la ubicación de su negocio está situado en su vivienda pues con la ayuda de su esposo ha salido adelante, todas las compras de sus productos las realiza ene le mercado. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es brindarle estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Delia Maria, 48, has three independently employed children. She sells firewood, cooked beans and curds. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. Because of the poor schooling she got, her employment options were very limited. So, she had to come up with a way to earn income in order to survive. Delia is a very humble woman; her business is located in her home. With her husband's help, they get by. She buys all her supplies in the market. The funding will be used to buy raw materials. Her desire is to provide economic stability to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Kitto Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
M. Ibrahim is a determined man and the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is married with three children ages 2 - 13 years old and he also takes care of his parents. Ibrahim has a retail shop in the Kito trading centre and although he has a lot of competition from other traders, he is able to make profits that sustain his family as well as paying his children’s school fees.

Ibrahim is so grateful for his loans because they enable him to have increased stock as well as having quality products for sale. He wishes to become a wholesaler in future with the hope to build rental properties for an increased monthly income. Ibrahim needs a loan to be able to restock his shop with more goods.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase printed cloth

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 30 años vive al lado de su pareja y sus dos hijos; Javier de 9 y Edson de 5 años. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia.
Desde hace 6 meses se dedica al alquiler de su motocarro, puesto que el tener hijos pequeños a los cuales cuidar no tiene el tiempo suficiente para dedicarse a una labor de tiempo completo. Por tal motivo, gracias a los ahorros que ella y su esposo guardaron durante algún tiempo compraron un motocarro. Y ahora puede alquilar este vehículo para generar a su familia ganancias extras. Sin embargo, el alquiler de su motocarro es una gran responsabilidad, ya que algunos chóferes no cuidan el vehículo, es por ello que María debe estar muy pendiente de la administración del mismo. 

Este es el doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, ella es una cliente muy bien considerada, debido a la puntualidad en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita refaccionará su motocarro para brindar un mejor servicio, ya que en la actualidad presenta algunos desperfectos.
texts.en:
María is 30 years old and lives with her partner and their two children, Javier (age 9) and Edson (age 5). They live in their own home.

For the past six months, she has been renting out her motorcycle taxi because having young children does not give her enough time to devote to a full-time job. Thanks to the savings she and her husband set aside, they were able to buy a motorcycle taxi. Now they rent out this vehicle so that they can generate extra income for their family. However, renting out their motorcycle taxi carries great responsibility because some of the drivers do not take care of the vehicle. For this reason, María must carefully manage how the vehicle is being handled.

This is her twelfth loan from MFP. María is a highly-regarded client because she makes all of her payments on time. With the money she is requesting, she will pay for repairs to her motorcycle taxi so that it can provide better service. At the moment, the vehicle has some damage.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Maria Nancy

texts.es:
El banco comunal Barrio Sucre se encuentra en la parroquia de Cumbe al sureste de la ciudad de Cuenca, sugente se dedica principalmente a la elaboración de artesanías de tejido, bordado e hilado de lana de oveja para la confección de sus prendas de vestir,  también se dedica a la agricultura y muchos de ellos han migrado a las grandes ciudades o al exterior en busca de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

 María Fernández es otra socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia  Cumbe, tiene 40 años de edad, está divorciada hace 3 años y la ruptura de su matrimonio se dio por otra mujer, con su esposo concibió 3 hijos que se encuentran de 17, 16, 5 años de edad, sus hijos mayores trabajan en la construcción cuando alguien les contrata aportando lo poco que ganan para los gastos del hogar y el estudio de su hermana menor,  la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad, ya que es la herencia de su esposo para sus hijos.

María se dedica a la venta de hortalizas en la Feria Libre, esta actividad realiza  desde sus  12 años porque ayudaba a su mamá  en la venta los lunes, sábados y domingos desde 07h00 a 19h00 y ahora ella sigue con esta tracidión, nuestra socia lleva 2 años trabajando con su bankito y nos comenta que le han ayudado mucho para incrementar otros legumbres y frutas en su puesto para ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes,  con  el crédito que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a comprar tomate, cebolla,arveja, zanahoria y otras legumbres para abastecer su negocio.

Su gran sueño es salir adelante con sus hijos y entregarle un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
The Barrio Sucre Communal Bank is located in the parish of Cumbe to the southeast of the city of Cuenca, Peru. Those who live there work mainly in the production of traditional textiles, embroidery, and wool yarn that is used to make clothing. Others work in agriculture and many have migrated to larger cities or out of the country searching for a better future for their families. Maria F. is one member of the Barrio Sucre Communal Bank. She lives on the outskirts of Cuenca in the parish of Cumbe. She is 40 years old and has been divorced for three years. Her marriage was broken up by another woman. With her husband she had three children who are now 17, 16 and 5 years old. Her older sons work in construction when there is work to be found. They contribute what little they earn to the household and to their younger sister’s education. The house they live in is theirs, as it was the inheritance left to the children by their father. Maria works selling vegetables at the Feria Libre, a large market in Cuenca. She has been in this line of work since she was 12, as she used to help her mother with sales on Mondays, Saturdays and Sundays from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm. She keeps the same work hours today. Maria has been working with this little bank for two years and she tells us that it has helped her to increase the number of vegetables and fruits at her stand and offer her customers a variety of products. With the loan offered to her by FUNDACION ESPOIR [a Kiva Field Partner] she will buy tomatoes, onions, peas, carrots and other vegetables to stock her business. Her great dream is to get ahead along with her children and to give them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables such as tomatoes, onions, peas, carrots and some fruits

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia M. is from the village of Sto. Nino Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old. Aurelia is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Aurelia owns & operates a furniture making business (wood, cabinet divider, doors and more) to local community members. Aurelia has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
48-year-old Jocelyn is a married woman from South Cotabato. She has six children, the oldest age 20. She raises ducks for a living. She also runs a small store located at her house. She says that she works hard for her children. She wants to provide them with a proper education so they will have a brighter future. 

Jocelyn joined CEVI in 2008 and says that her previous loans were truly helpful to her business and family. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more ducks and feed. She is hopeful that this loan will help her business a lot.

loans.use: To buy ducks and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 22-year-old single man. He started tailoring three years ago after he finished high school. He makes and sells men's suits and trousers. He has membership with Sunshine self help group in Faulu Kenya. He appreciates the group members for previously guaranteeing him a loan of KES 20,000. He used this loan to boost his business, and currently he is able to pay rent for his business premises. He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to buy fabric for making suits. He hopes to get married and be able to educate his children in the future.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhoem A., a 59-year-old resident of a rural commune in Phnom Penh City, works as a local tailor from home, a job she started in 2006. She was married many years ago to MA. Chorn, who is an advisor in a pagoda. The couple has four single children, and one who is married and lives separately. Two of her children who are employed contribute a little income to help with the family expenses. Nhoem A. sews silk clothes which people like to wear A. ceremonies. Recently, she is lacking some raw materials she needs to continue her sewing services. This is why she has decided to ask for a loan of $500 from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Groupe 2 De Nissondiya

texts.fr:
Le  groupe 2 de l’association Nissondiya de Daoulabougou est composé de huit  femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames et ayant en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Daoulabougou dans la commune rurale de Konodimini dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de parenté et de mariage. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter la production de leurs parcelles de culture d’arachide et de mil, elles ont adhéré au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt de campagne.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, une tonne de complexe céréales, 300kg de semences d’arachide et recruter de la main d’œuvre masculine pour effectuer le labour.  
Elles se ravitaillent  généralement en intrants agricoles au marché de  Konodimini. 
Nagnini D. qui est la présidente du groupe fait exclusivement de l’arachide sur sa parcelle.
Tandis que le groupe compte récolter 20 tonnes d’arachide et 4 tonnes de mil, Nagnini seule espère sur 3 tonnes d’arachide. 
Une partie de la production est auto-consommée et le reste sera vendu pour pouvoir assurer les soins de santé des membres du foyer et l’éducation des enfants à l’école.
texts.en:
The 8 members of the 2nd group of the Association Nissondiya of Daoulabougou are married women, mostly in polygamous families. On average, they are 32 years old with 2 children. They live in the village of Daoulabougou, in the rural commune Konodimini, in the Ségou region (Mali’s 4th Administrative Region.) They are all related by marriage. The women decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to augment the productivity of their parcels of land where they grow peanuts and millet. This is their first loan cycle. They plan to use the proceeds to purchase 1 ton of grain and 300 kilograms of peanut seed, and to hire men to do the manual labor. The purchase their soil amendments from wholesalers in Konodimini. Nagnini D., who is president of the group, just grows peanuts on her parcel. Altogether, they expect to raise 20 tons of peanuts and 4 tons of millet. Nagnini expects her farm to produce 3 tons of peanuts. Part of the production will be for their families’ consumption, and the rest will be sold to pay for children’s schooling and to help with the families’ health care.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pay hired laborers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
On top of being a vibrant entrepreneur, Josephine is married to a pharmacist and together they have three kids from age 16-27 years old. Currently, all her kids are pursuing education at the tertiary level. It is Josephine’s dreams to support her children to successfully complete their tertiary education.

Josephine has been selling groceries like soap, canned foods, evaporated milk, crates of eggs, toiletries, washing powder, etc. for the past twenty years. Petty trading like the sale of groceries is widespread in Ghana because it is easy to start up. It usually begins with table-top selling and then grows to become a kiosk and may eventually become a supermarket. Josephine plans to invest the loan in the purchase of groceries in bulk to meet her demand.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem has lived all of her life in a city called Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is 29 and a mother of four children who are all still very young. Her husband belongs to a plants selling business. He has the contacts with the other nurseries (plant sales outlet). 

He also has a nursery where he displays purchased plants for resale. He has been doing this business for 13 years, now he wants to expand his business for which Tasleem has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah. With the loan amount her husband will buy more plants and sell them at his nursery. 

Tasleem hopes that with the help of an investment, her husband’s income will be increased which will help her to send her children to school.

loans.use: plants for nursery (plant sales outlet)

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda H. is from the village of Acad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old. Erlinda is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to expand the business

loans.name: Rosevelt

texts.en: Rosevelt S. is from the village of Olango. He is 40 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Rosevelt owns and operates a business providing motorcycle tricycle transport services. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rosevelt joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
This is Nena P., 32, resident of Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Angel P., and mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in elementary while the oldest child is in high school. By the grace of God, Nena has managed to support her older child's schooling up to high school level. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send them all the way through college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Juanita, as she herself has been a college undergraduate, and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Nena operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php24,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Nena dreams of being able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase packs of used clothing for children and adults

loans.name: Nempapa Tean

texts.en:
Nempapa is a farmer and has two children: Sanayan and Nterere. She joined KADET through other existing members. Nempapa is in the business of selling clothes and jewelry and plans to use her loan to add more jewelry stock. She operates in a busy marketplace, where her customers are able to get the items and, at the same time, most tourists who come to Kenya can get jewelry easily from her shop.

Nempapa will use the extra profits from the loan so her children can go to college. She hopes to stock tourist products. Nempapa believes she is hard-working and ambitious.

loans.use: To increase her stock of jewelry

loans.name: Matda

texts.en:
Matda C. is from the village of Estrada. She is 47 years old. Matda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Matda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man living with his wife. He has been working in flooring since 2002, and he is specialized in floor polishing. He has been involved in this occupation for almost eleven years. He also installs glass windows as his secondary occupation. It is very common in Lebanon to have two jobs to be able to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new polishing machine specialized in crystallizing the floor and making it shinier.

loans.use: purchase a new polishing machine

loans.name: Constansa

texts.es: Constansa, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abdón de 46 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Constansa ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, café, caco y hoja de coca, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, donde las vende al por mayor a sus compradores, quienes esperan sus cultivos debido a la buena calidad que tienen. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus plantaciones. Este es el décimo cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, hará limpiar su chacra y contratará peones, para que la ayuden en el cultivo.
texts.en:
Constansa is 35 years old.  She is a very humble and happy woman.  She lives in her own home together with her husband Abdón who is 46 years old and her 5 beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better future.  With a lot of effort Constansa has managed to work her land and make it very productive.  She grows coffee, cacao and coca leaf, products which she then takes to sell in the city of San Francisco.  She sells her products wholesale to her customers who wait for her crops owing to their good quality.  What she most likes about her work is tending to her crops which she does with a lot of care.  She has been in this business for 15 years and considers the most difficult thing about her work to be transporting her products since the sacks that she carries are very heavy and they make her very tired.  In the future she would like to buy new land to widen her plantations.

This is her fourteenth loan from MFP.  She has been very punctual in making repayments on her previous loans and she hopes to keep this up.  She is a very active member of her community bank and she is always up to date with the agreements which they reach in her group.  She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles which she is requesting to clean her farm and to contract laborers to help her with her crops.

loans.use: To contract laborers to help her to clean her farm and grow crops

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 28-year-old married man with two children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He longs to have an educated family. He has been in the motorcycle transport sector for three years, which has helped him to provide the basics for his family. His desire is to have at least four motorcycles for business purposes. He needs this loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio San Rafael. 
Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación ParA., con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  3º con sus 14 integrantes.  

Todas las integrantes del comité están muy agradecidas con la Fundación ParA. por el valioso apoyo que les brinda para poder mejorar sus condiciones financieras en la sociedad.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rossana trabaja como empleada domestica en un casa de familia y le gusta mucho formar parte de comité ya que aprende mucho de las demás integrantes.
Ella es muy trabajadora y desea continuar con el grupo hasta conseguir armar para su propio negocio.
Actualmente los créditos que ella solicita son para la compra de artículos que utilizan en la casa.
texts.en:
The women of this committee come from the neighbourhood of San Rafael. The ladies are very satisfied with the economic support that the [field partner] Fundación ParA. is bringing them. With this capital the ladies are enlarging their small businesses as well as their incomes for a better quality of living. The ladies are in cycle number 3 with their 14 members.

All the members of the commitee are very grateful to the Fundación ParA. for the valuable support that it brings them to be able to improve their financial conditions in society.

One of the members is Ms. Rossana who works as a domestic employee in a family's house. She is very happy to be a part of the committee as she learns a lot from the other members. She is very hard-working and wants to continue with the group until she manages to put together her own business. The loans which she is currently requesting are for the purchase of items that they use in the house.

loans.use: To buy household items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his home

loans.name: Mainifo

texts.en:
Mainifo T. is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Saasaai.  She is married and has 5 children.  To make a living, Mainifo operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business is planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Mainifo has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Mainifo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Mainifo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1000 WST from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  Mainifo is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  The loan will be the second loan Mainifo has taken out from SPBD.  Mainifo plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Sin L., 24, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. L. is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 66 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. L. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more construction supplements to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more construction supplements to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael A. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 54 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Michael owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as sugar, canned goods, noodles, rice, soft drinks, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Michael has been engaged in his business for over 8 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Michael joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Michael is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Michael from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila H. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Mila is married and has 11 adult-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a business planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional capital for her business. Mila is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Mila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann N. is 24 years old, married to Solomon and blessed with one child. Ann runs a retail shop and has been in this business for the last two years. This is her first loan from Kiva partner, KADET, and she plans to use the loan to purchase sugar, soft drinks, salt, flour, tea leaves, cooking oil, baking powder and rice for her business. The anticipated profits will be directed into the repayment of her loan. Her hope and dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, soft drinks, salt, flour, tea leaves, cooking oil, baking powder and rice

loans.name: Ket

texts.en: Ket C. lives with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for its pre-Angkorean temples. C. is a weaver, earning an income of  $1.5 USD per day. Her husband is a electrician, earning an income of $4 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend $75 USD on food and $50 USD on other necessary expenses. C. is requesting a loan of $600 USD to purchase equipment for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy electrical equipment for her husband's business

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos la señora Ruth, tiene 47 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus  tres hijos los mismos que en la actualidad ya son  mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y trabajan.
 
Tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, en ella también vende artículos de bazar y helados. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00, además de esto también prepara almuerzos para vender, nos cuenta que todos los días hasta su local llegan bastantes clientes a servirse los deliciosos platos que ella vende pero que mas clientela tiene los fines de semana. Los productos para su tienda los compra en Manta y algunos  los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva con su negocio tres años y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos como: arroz, azúcar, enlatados, detergentes, carnes, pescado, etc. que también le sirven para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde que lo fundaron, es la tesorera del mismo y le gusta por la unión del grupo.
 
Su sueño es tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Esperanza y Progreso" meets every two weeks in the Montecristi Canton, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and crafts and renowned both nationally and internationally.  It is the place of the famous "panama" straw hat.

Here we meet Mrs. Ruth who is 47 yeras old.  Several years ago her husband passed away and she was left alone with her three children who are now adults.  Two of them still live at home and work.

She runs a grocery store in her house and also sells bazaar items and ice cream.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. and also prepares and sells lunches.  She says considerable customers come for her delicious meals every day but weekends are when sales are at their highest.  She buys the products for her store in Manta.  Some are delivered to her store.  She has been in business for three years and it is going quite well.

This loan is to buy products such as rice, sugar, canned goods, detergent, meat, fish, etc., some of which are also used to prepare food.  She's been a member of the communal bank since it was founded, acting as its treasurer, and enjoys the group's close relationship.

Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, canned goods, detergent, meat, fish, etc.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
